p.text: [p]B-O-R-I-N-G. That's how you'd describe your family vacation in New York City. Instead of visiting all the cool spots, like Rockefeller Center and the Statue of Liberty, your parents drag you to a bunch of stupid museums.[/p] [p]Then, at the Museum of Natural History, something really strange hapens. You accidentally get involved in a strange experiment that sends you travelling through time![/p] [p]Will you duel with knights at a medieval castle? Come face-to-face with man-eating dinosaurs? Or take a ride through outer space?[/p]

[p]Your little brother, Denny, runs off by himself in the huge Museum of Natural History building! You try to find him, but instead you discover the laboratory of the strange Dr. Peebles.[/p] [p]The scientist “volunteers” you to test his new time machine! [em]Wow[/em], you think. [em]I'm going to be the first time-traveling kid ever![/em] Then Denny runs right into the machine – and vanishes![/p] [p]Well, your brother's not lost in the museum anymore. Now he's lost in time! You have to find him – again. But where? In the distant past, where fierce dinosaurs roam? Or in medieval times, battling with knights and wizards? Maybe in the future, where robots rule over humans! The one thing you know for sure is – [em]you must find Denny in two hours or he'll be lost forever![/em][/p]

[p]What a crummy vacation![/p] [p]You, your little brother Denny, and your parents have come to New York City for Christmas vacation. You thought you'd get to do a lot of cool things, like visit the Statue of Liberty, ride to the 102nd floor of the World Trade Center, and ice-skate at Rockefeller Center.[/p] [p]Instead, your parents are museum freaks.[/p] [p]“It's entertaining,” your mom says as she drags you into the Museum of Natural History.[/p] [p]“It's educational,” your dad declares as he shows you a collection of ancient pottery.[/p] [p]“It's boring!” you say, but no one listens.[/p] [p]And the worst part is that you're supposed to be in charge of your little red-haired brother Denny. Only Denny doesn't want anyone to be in charge of him. “You're not the boss of me!” he keeps saying.[/p] [p]You follow your parents through the Museum of Natural History. At first it is kind of interesting. You really like the dinosaurs.[/p] [p]“Wait till you see what's in this room!” your mom cries.[/p]

[p]You rush to the next room, expecting something exciting. But your mom is standing in front of a sundial. “Isn't this wonderful?” she exclaims. “An exhibit on time!”[/p] [p]Great, you think. A whole roomful of clocks! Boring![/p] [p]Then Denny gives you a karate kick in the back of the leg.[/p] [p]“Ow!” you cry. “Stop it!”[/p] [p]“You're not the boss of me!” he says smugly.[/p] [p]“Yes, I am!” you reply, punching him in the arm. He whines and complains to your parents. You can't win![/p] [p]“I'm thirsty,” Denny says now. You can see he's eaten almost half a bag of Gummi Bears in less than a minute.[/p] [p]“Can you find a drinking fountain for Denny, dear?” your mom asks without taking her eyes off a grandfather clock.[/p] [p]“Come on.” You grab Denny's hand. But Denny pulls away and runs off down a hallway. You follow him. The hallway twists and turns. There's no sign of either Denny or a water fountain. But near the end of the hall you see a sign on a door:[p] [p class="centered"]WARNING![br/] DANGEROUS EXPERIMENT INSIDE[br/] THIS DOOR MUST BE KEPT LOCKED AT ALL TIMES[/p]

[p]Dangerous experiment? What does that mean? you wonder. You notice that the door is slightly open. Oh, no! Denny must have run in here, you think.[/p] [p]You push the door open wider and peek in. There's no sign of Denny. A tall, skinny man with long white hair tied in a ponytail is bent over a computer. The computer is hooked up to a big, strange-looking clock. Between the computer and the clock is a large square contraption that looks like a picture frame. You can hear the computer and the clock beeping and pinging.[/p] [p]“It's about time you got here!” the tall man says, straightening up. “I'm Dr. Peebles. You must be the volunteer.”[/p] [p]“Actually,” you start to say, “I'm looking for –”[/p] [p]“There's no time to waste!” Dr. Peebles interrupts. “I'm ready to start the experiment. Come on over.”[/p] [p]“Well, I –”[/p] [p]“Here!” he says. He places a chain around your neck. On the end of the chain is something that looks like a stopwatch. A very, very odd stopwatch, with a complicated-looking dial and four big knobs.[/p] [p]“Are you ready?” Dr. Peebles asks.[/p]

[p]“Ready for what?” you ask.[/p] [p]“Why, to travel in time, of course,” he replies. “You'll be the first human in history to use my traveling chronometer.”[/p] [p]“Chronometer?” you echo. “What's that?”[/p] [p]He points to the stopwatch around your neck.[/p] [p]“I don't have time –” you start to say, but he interrupts again.[/p] [p]“Of course you have time!” Dr. Peebles goes on. “It doesn't matter how long you remain in the past or future. When you return to the present, it will be the same moment that you left. It will be as if you weren't gone at all.”[/p] [p]“How does this work?” you ask, pointing to the stopwatch.[/p] [p]“It's easy,” says Dr. Peebles. “Press the button on the left side to travel to the past. Press the button on the right for the future. To return to the present, press the top button and the bottom button at the same time.”[/p] [p]Cool! you think. What if this guy's invention really works? Traveling in time would be awesome![/p] [p]“There's no time to waste!” Dr. Peebles says. “I'm ready to begin the experiment now.”[/p]

[p]You think for a moment. Dr. Peebles obviously believes you're someone else. But a trip through time sounds like a lot of fun. More fun than staring at crummy old bowls all day. And since you'll return at the exact same time you left, you'll still be able to find Denny and return to your parents before they know anything is wrong.[/p] [p]On the other hand, Denny can get into a lot of trouble very fast. And your parents will blame [em]you[/em] if anything happens.[/p] [p]Make a decision now. Do you want to travel in time? Or should you look for your brother first?[/p]
p.next: If you choose to volunteer for Dr. Peebles's experiment
If you think you'd better stay and look for Denny

p.text: [p]“Use the key and open the lock!” the woman begs.[/p] [p]You hear the dragon's heavy footsteps approaching. “What key?” you ask.[/p] [p]“The key around your neck!”[/p] [p]You glance down at the chronometer. It seems to be the same shape as the keyhole. “But this isn't a key,” you protest. “It's a chronometer!”[/p] [p]“I don't care what it is!” the woman cries. “Use it!”[/p] [p]At that moment flames shoot out of the opening in the wall. The dragon's huge, scaly face appears. Its evil yellow eyes narrow when it sees you.[/p] [p]Quick! Make a decision! Should you try to use the chronometer as a key to rescue the woman? Or should you just get out of there as fast as you can?[/p] [p]Hurry! The dragon's about to breathe fire again![/p]

[p][em]KABBOOOM![/em] [/p] [p]You zip out the bottom of the chute just as the plant blows up. A moment later you are surrounded by cheering rebels.[/p] [p]“You did it!” Jarmal slaps you on the back. “The war isn't over yet, but I am sure that we will win.”[/p] [p]“Now help me find my brother,” you say.[/p] [p]“I've located him on the space station,” Jarmal tells you. “Some of the rebels sent him there for safety.”[/p] [p]“I have to go there,” you say.[/p] [p]Jarmal nods and leads you to a small space shuttle. “This will take you there,” he tells you. “Good luck.”[/p] [p]You say good-bye, then strap yourself into the automated ship.[/p]

[p]As the dragon moves nearer, you can feel the heat from its fiery breath.[/p] [p]What are you going to do?[/p] [p]It breathes fire again. Flames lick your feet.[/p] [p]“Dragon breath!” you hiss suddenly.[/p] [p]The dragon looks at you, startled.[/p] [p]“Dragon breath!” you say again.[/p] [p]This time it takes a few steps backward.[/p] [p]“Haven't you ever heard of mouthwash?” you say.[/p] [p]By now the dragon is hanging its head in shame.[/p] [p]You're not sure how much longer you can keep this up. But for now you've managed to stop yourself from meeting a fiery[/p] [p class="end"]END[/p]

[p]“I choose school,” you tell the judge.[/p] [p]The robot policeman drags you off to another room in the same building. You are surprised to see that it's a regular classroom with wooden desks, a blackboard, and a computer center. There is also a metal box the size of a closet standing in the front of the room.[/p] [p]The desks are all filled with human students about your age.[/p] [p]“We will continue the quiz now,” the teacher says in a hollow voice. “Anita, what is the capital of Ulan Bator?”[/p] [p]A girl stands nervously. “I – I don't know,” she stammers.[/p] [p]“Then you must enter the frammilizer,” the teacher says.[/p] [p]The girl bites her fingernails as she goes to the front of the room. She climbs into the metal box. The teacher slams the door shut and presses a button. The box hums, then glows bright green. When the door springs open, you gasp out loud.[/p]

[p]“The battle has started!” Jarmal shouts. “The domination of machines over people will end! Are you with us or against us?”[/p] [p]“Well, I –” Your words are drowned out by more explosions. The men and women around you have grabbed weapons and are racing down the tunnel.[/p] [p]“I'm against the robots!” you shout to Jarmal. “But I have to find my brother! If I don't get back to the present, we'll both be stuck somewhere in time.”[/p] [p]“That's not my problem!” Jarmal snaps.[/p] [p]You turn away from him.[/p] [p]“We saw a child a day ago,” Jarmal says in a softer tone. “Perhaps he was your brother. But he ran off and hid from us. I promise we'll help you find him – but only after you've joined us in fighting the robots. Do you agree – or not?”[/p] [p]Think it over carefully. You have only an hour till your time runs out. Can you trust Jarmal to help you find Denny? Or should you go back up to the streets now and look for Denny there?[/p]

[p]Denny loves dinosaurs. You decide to explore the swamp where you saw the dinosaur. You're sure Denny went that way.[/p] [p]As you move toward the swamp, tall, fernlike vegetation surrounds you. Your feet sink into the thick, mucky water.[/p] [p]Through the trees you can see huge shapes moving about. Real dinosaurs! Cool! you think. This is just like [em]Jurassic Park[/em] – only better![/p] [p]The dinosaurs are red, blue, green, and lavender – as colorful as birds. Some dinosaurs are the size of dogs and cats. Other dinosaurs are bigger than a house. They're all munching on leaves and weeds.[/p] [p]You're about to move closer when a tremendous noise shakes the ground.[/p] [p]The trees sway as the rumbling grows louder. And louder. What's happening?[/p] [p]You peer through the giant ferns toward a grassy plain. Your eyes grow wide. You can't believe it. Lumbering toward you is – a [em]Tyrannosaurus rex![/em][/p]

[p]You reach into the pool of quicksand and feel around for the chronometer. Suddenly, the ground begins to shake violently. Under your feet the earth sways, and a deafening rumble fills the air.[/p] [p]“What's going on?” you yell to Denny. Smoke pours out of the top of a nearby mountain.[/p] [p]“A volcano!” you shout.[/p] [p]A second later, the top of the volcano blows off. Red-hot lava pours out. Even though the volcano is at least a half mile away, you can feel the heat against your skin.[/p] [p]Large rocks, glowing white-hot, begin to land in the swamp like bombs. “Watch out!” Denny shrieks. “Duck!”[/p] [p]You cover your head and throw yourself on the ground.[/p] [p][em]Whoomp![/em] A rock just misses you. It splashes into the mud and throws up a shower of mud and water and – something shiny.[/p] [p]Could it be? Yes, it's the chronometer![/p] [p]Quickly, you crawl over and scoop it up. It's covered with mud. Desperately, you feel for the buttons on the side of the chronometer. Your fingers close on two of them.[/p]

[p]You push the driver aside and manage to get your hand on the steering wheel.[/p] [p]You try to pull the truck to the right, but it's much harder than you thought. The horrified faces of your family – including your own – loom in the windshield.[/p] [p]“GET OUT OF THE WAY!” you scream.[/p] [p]In desperation, you pull again on the wheel. With a sudden lurch, the truck veers to the right.[/p] [p]You breathe a sigh of relief. You've done it! You've saved your family![/p] [p]But you'd better hold on tight. You still can't stop the truck. And this time the runaway vehicle is headed right at a brick wall! Stop reading right here. You don't really want to know what happens next. Let's just say you were a hit on Broadway.[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You smile. You knew you could count on your brother's greed.[/p] [p]King Ruthbert orders the knight at your side to free your hands. You pull the chronometer off your neck. Glancing at it, you see that you and Denny only have five more minutes before disappearing in time.[/p] [p]“Denny,” you tell him, “this is your last chance to return to the present. Please –”[/p] [p]“No!” Denny yells. “Forget it! I'm not going!”[/p] [p]“Give the boy the trinket!” the king bellows.[/p] [p]The knight beside you grabs for the chronometer. You whip your hands out of the way. The knight loses his balance and bumps you. You feel yourself falling off the platform – straight into the pot of boiling oil![/p]

[p]“He's just an ordinary twentieth-century kid!” you protest.[/p] [p]“I'm not ordinary!” Denny yells. “I don't like this person,” he adds, whining to the king.[/p] [p]“Listen to me, Denny!” you shout. “You're in big trouble. You've got to come with me now!”[/p] [p]“You're not the boss of me!” Denny yells.[/p] [p]“Boil this spy in oil!” shouts the king.[/p] [p]“Yeah!” Denny agrees, clapping. “Boil the spy in oil!”[/p] [p]“Denny, you're my [em]brother![/em] ” you protest in horror. But Denny just smirks his obnoxious smirk.[/p] [p]Then the two knights grab you and begin to drag you out of the Throne Room.[/p] [p]“Wait!” you shout. “You're making a terrible mistake!”[/p] [p]But no one listens. You're dragged up to the roof of the castle. There, you see a bubbling black pot.[/p] [p]Yikes! Your hands are tied behind you. You can't use the chronometer. Unless a miracle happens, you're about to be boiled in oil![/p] [p]Is this your lucky day?[/p]

[p]“I think my brother went to the future,” you announce.[/p] [p]“I hope you're right.” Dr. Peebles punches another computer key. “Are you ready? Step through the Chronoport.”[/p] [p]You enter the glowing frame. As you move through it you feel a strange tingling sensation.[/p] [p]“One more thing!” Dr. Peebles calls out. His voice sounds far away. “Before you can return, remember –”[/p] [p]“What?” you cry as his words fade away. What was he saying?[/p] [p]Ahead of you in the mist are two scenes: a big, futuristic-looking city with small cars flying around like planes.[/p] [p]Another view seems to be of New York City. You recognize a few buildings, like the World Trade Center and the Empire State Building. As you watch, a small red-haired boy who looks like Denny disappears behind another tall building. But is it really your brother?[/p] [p]Make a decision![/p]
p.next: Is Denny in the strange city?
Or is he the red-haired boy in New York?

p.text: [p]Denny shrugs and starts to explain. “I went through that door, and –”[/p] [p]But time is running out. You cut him off. “Stay here, okay?”[/p] [p]“You're not the boss of me!” Denny whines.[/p] [p]You groan. Your little brother is never going to cooperate unless you tell him the plan.[/p] [p]You whisper in his ear.[/p] [p]Denny gives you a big smile. “I'll stay around for [em]that[/em],” he promises.[/p]

[p]Herring Bros, is a big garage on the ground floor of a large, high-rise building. You step inside. There are just a few trucks. The only green one is easy to spot by the far wall.[/p] [p]In a booth by another wall, a woman with a microphone and headset sits behind a glass window. She's the dispatcher for the delivery firm. Maybe you can stop her from sending out the truck. Or would it be better to talk to the truck driver himself?[/p]

[p]You step up to the wizard's door, take a deep breath, and pull it open. Inside is a dim, smoky room. It's filled with a jumble of books, tables, pots of boiling liquid, crystal balls, and other strange magical equipment.[/p] [p]“Hello!” you call. “Denny? Is anyone here?”[/p] [p]The only answer is a rustling sound behind you.[/p] [p]“Denny?” you shout, whirling around.[/p] [p]You gasp when you see what's there.[/p] [p]Crouched on a pile of rags behind the table is the biggest lizard you've ever seen. Around its neck is an iron collar with a name tag that reads … WIZARD![/p] [p]A lizard named Wizard?[/p] [p]The lizard's cold black eyes gaze at you. Its narrow tongue flicks in and out. You take a step backward.[/p] [p]As the reptile starts toward you, you recognize the pile of rags it was sitting on – Denny's clothes![/p] [p]You swallow hard. Now you know what happened to your brother …[/p] [p]And what will happen to you![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]“Excuse me,” you say to the dispatcher. “Can you help me?”[/p] [p]She slides open the glass window and says: “Here you are, finally! You're late.”[/p] [p]She obviously thinks you're one of the shipping clerks. You are about to explain when she points to a red truck. “You've got to load those crates right now,” she says, adding, “Abe doesn't like to be kept waiting.”[/p] [p]You look in the direction she's pointing and you see that the red truck is parked right near the green truck – the truck you have to stop. Maybe this is your chance to delay the green truck.[/p]

[p]As you look on in horror, your father sees the runaway truck. He throws out his arms to hold back you, your mother, and Denny.[/p] [p]Your family halts in their tracks … and the truck speeds on past![/p] [p]You did it! You saved your family![/p] [p]Now you've got to grab Denny and get back to Dr. Peebles's lab.[/p] [p]“Come on, Denny,” you call.[/p] [p]“No!” Denny cries. “You can't make me!”[/p] [p]You glance at the chronometer. Dr. Peebles said you had to return within two hours of real time. The minutes are ticking by. You have to take Denny back as soon as possible, or you could get lost in time.[/p] [p]You're bigger and stronger – should you just grab him? Or can you talk him into going with you?[/p]

[p]If only you'd taken swimming lessons when your mom wanted you to! You decide not to jump into the moat. You face the knight and his spear.[/p] [p]Right before he reaches you, the knight reins in his horse.[/p] [p]“Who are you, stranger?” he demands.[/p] [p]“I'm a visitor from the future. I'm searching for my brother.”[/p] [p]“No one enters King Ruthbert's castle unless he can meet the challenge!” he replies.[/p] [p]“What challenge?” you ask.[/p] [p]“You must fight me, his Noble Defender, in a duel,” the knight says with a smirk. “The loser will become food for the king's crocodiles in the moat.”[/p] [p]Crocodiles in the moat? Good thing you didn't jump in after all![/p] [p]The knight dismounts and pulls a bag of weapons from his saddle. You see a spear, a sword, a spiky chain, and a huge wooden club. “Here, you may choose your weapon,” he says.[/p] [p]This guy really wants to have a [em]duel[/em] ?[/p] [p]“Well,” the knight says impatiently. “Choose!”[/p]

[p]“King who?” you ask.[/p] [p]“Do you take me for an idiot!” the knight snarls. “Henry's forces are expected to attack any day! Don't deny you're an advance scout!”[/p] [p]“I'm a kid from the future!” you repeat. “I only want –”[/p] [p]But the knight doesn't listen. He quickly ties your hands behind your back, then drags you up to the throne. He tosses you at the king's feet.[/p] [p]“Who is this?” the king demands.[/p] [p]“A spy for King Henry!” the knight answers.[/p] [p]You look up to deny it. That's when you notice who's sitting on the small throne next to the king.[/p] [p]Denny![/p] [p]“I've been looking all over for you!” you tell him. “We've got to get back to Dr. Peebles's lab! You can't stay –”[/p] [p]“Silence!” King Ruthbert bellows. “No one speaks to my son without permission!”[/p] [p]“Your son?” you gasp. “But this is my brother, Denny –”[/p] [p]“He's my son, Ruthelford!” the king interrupts. “I always wanted a son. When this boy appeared, I adopted him!”[/p]

[p]Disguised in the uniform, you hurry out of the closet to explore the space station.[/p] [p]This place is too cool. Through the windows you can see thousands of stars. Sophisticated-looking computers with colorful lights are scattered all over this place.[/p] [p]The chronometer's steady ticking reminds you that time is running out. You'd better find Denny quickly and get back to the present.[/p] [p]You wander through a door and see a sign pointing to something called TELETIME.[/p] [p]Then two robots approach. One of them draws a laser.[/p] [p]Just ahead is a branch in the corridor. A green sign points to HYDROPONICS and a purple one points to ENGINE ROOM.[/p] [p]Make a choice and start running![/p]
p.next: Follow the green sign to Hydroponics
Take the purple sign to the Engine Room

p.text: [p]“I'm a new crew member,” you lie to the captain. “I'm not a spy. I've been working in the Hydroponics area.”[/p] [p]“Then why didn't you know the antigrav device is off limits?” she demands.[/p] [p]“I haven't finished reading the rule book,” you say.[/p] [p]“Maybe so,” the captain grumbles. She hesitates, then fires a question at you. “Are the crew quarters forward or aft?”[/p] [p]“Aft,” you reply, hoping you're right.[/p] [p]“That's correct,” she says. “But if you are a real crew member, what is the code for a space drill? A-Zero or X-Two?”[/p] [p]“A-Zero,” you tell her.[/p] [p]“You are an imposter and a spy!” she shouts in triumph. “There is no space drill – and even the newest rookie knows it!” She turns to the robot guards at her side. “Shove this spy out through the airlock!” she orders.[/p] [p]“Hey – what about partial credit?” you yell, but it's no good. As you step out of the airlock, your whole body explodes.[/p] [p]Very messy. Very scary. Very much[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]“Excuse me, sir,” you say, approaching the truck driver. “The dispatcher said you might be able to help me,” you explain. “My family and I are from out of town. I got separated from them earlier, and I'm wondering if you can give me a ride to my hotel.”[/p] [p]“Sure thing, kid,” he says. “Where is it?”[/p] [p]You give him the address, near the Museum of Natural History.[/p] [p]“That's right on my way,” he says. “Come on, let's get started.”[/p] [p]With a smile of relief, you follow him to the truck and strap yourself into the passenger seat.[/p] [p]“How do you like the city, kid?” he asks as the truck barrels along a broad avenue.[/p] [p]“It's great!” you tell him. “Lots of interesting-”[/p] [p]“Uh-oh!” the driver interrupts. “The accelerator!” he yells. “It's stuck!”[/p] [p]The truck tears down the street. You glance back and forth from the driver to the crowded intersection straight ahead. You can see your family about to cross the street – and the truck is gaining speed![/p]

[p]“Wait!” you shout to the driver. “I've changed my mind!”[/p] [p]But it's too late. The driver can't hear you. With a lurch, the truck starts off.[/p] [p]The truck bumps along the city streets. Outside, you can hear honking horns and the engines of other trucks and cars. You're stuck back here with hundreds of dead fish – how are you going to save your family now?[/p] [p]You stand up and squeeze between the crates of fish. You make your way toward the driver's cab. You pound on the area behind the driver, trying to get his attention.[/p] [p]But the truck keeps going.[/p] [p]And starts to pick up speed! It swerves wildly, and outside you can hear honking horns and angry shouting.[/p] [p]The truck's out of control![/p] [p]And you're stuck inside it![/p] [p]It's too late to stop the truck this time. All you can do now is press the button on the chronometer, return to the past, and try something else.[/p]

[p]“The magical objects are three white stones,” you tell the robot.[/p] [p]The robot's face is blank. “Correct,” it says. “But we will see how you do on the next round.”[/p] [p]You know you're never going to make it through the next round. You quickly grasp the chronometer and press the button on the right to go farther into the future.[/p] [p]Immediately you feel a tingling sensation. When it stops, you're still seated – but not on the hard wooden chair in the classroom. Instead, you're strapped into a comfortable, soft seat. [em]Whooshing[/em] sounds surround you.[/p] [p]Is this an airplane?[/p] [p]You glance out a window. Outside is black, empty space, dotted with brilliant white stars. Up ahead is a big, doughnut-shaped structure with spaceships docked by its doors.[/p] [p]You're not on an airplane – you're on a space shuttle! And it's traveling toward a space station.[/p] [p]“Thirty seconds to docking!” an intercom squawks.[/p]

[p]You decide to try to trick the robot guards. You glance at the chronometer. Less than an hour left to find Denny and return to the present.[/p] [p]“When you get to the guards,” Jarmal says, “tell them you have been sent to fix the romiframpton.”[/p] [p]“What's that?” you ask.[/p] [p]“It's the central processor for the plant,” Jarmal says. “Either the guard will believe you and let you through – or he will vaporize you on the spot.”[/p] [p]Oh great, you think. No wonder no one else volunteered for this job. Jarmal gives you a pair of white coveralls to put on. You stick the red box in your pocket. “Good luck,” he tells you.[/p] [p]You take a deep breath and approach the entrance to the power plant. A big metal robot with a laser gun stops you. “What do you want, human?” it demands.[/p] [p]“I'm here to fix the romiframpton,” you say.[/p] [p]The robot hesitates. “We've received no report that it was broken.” Your stomach lurches. Are you going to be vaporized?[/p]

[p]The knight takes the club and holds it awkwardly.[/p] [p]This should be easy, you think as you pick an apple. You throw it to him – a fast pitch. To your surprise, he hits it – but the apple only flies a few feet.[/p] [p]“You'll never be able to beat that,” the knight says.[/p] [p]“We'll see,” you reply. He's never seen [em]you[/em] play ball.[/p] [p]You grip the club tightly as the knight picks an apple. He winds up, then tosses it toward you.[/p] [p]You keep your eye fixed on the shiny red ball as it soars through the air. You shouldn't have any problem hitting this baby.[/p] [p]You reach back with your bat and start to swing. Then the bat connects – with empty air! You missed![/p] [p]“Wait!” you cry. “Let me try again.”[/p] [p]“Sorry,” the knight says. “You can't change the rules.”[/p] [p]“But –”[/p] [p]“The crocodiles are hungry.” The knight picks you up in both his arms. “It's past their lunchtime!”[/p] [p]You start to reach for the chronometer. But it's too late. You're falling – falling into the moat. Below you are a dozen snapping jaws.[/p] [p]Too bad, batting champ! You've struck out big time![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You feel a strange tingling sensation as you press the buttons on the chronometer. When it stops you're still standing next to a newsstand. But a clock in a nearby store shows that it's fifteen minutes before the accident.[/p] [p]You can still stop it from happening![/p] [p]Your family has already started toward the corner.[/p] [p]You don't have much time! Should you do something to distract them? Or – just run across the street and warn them?[/p] [p]Think fast! The seconds are ticking by rapidly![/p]

[p]You're sure that your brother is somewhere in the cave. “Denny!” you yell. “Denny!”[/p] [p]You're getting used to the smell and the darkness. You squint at the chronometer and see that there's only about fifteen minutes until you and Denny are lost in time forever.[/p] [p]“Denny!” you call again.[/p] [p]At last you hear his faint answer. “Help me!” he calls. The sound is coming from underneath the straw.[/p] [p]You dig through the straw. Finally you find him, on the bottom, with ropes tied around his hands and feet.[/p] [p]“Who tied you up?” you ask as you quickly untie him.[/p] [p]“The lion,” he says.[/p] [p]A lion tied him up?[/p] [p]“Come on,” you say urgently. “Grab my hand. We've got to get back to the present!”[/p] [p]“You're not the boss of me!” Denny says. But you can see he's scared as he takes your hand.[/p] [p]You get ready to press the top and bottom buttons of the chronometer. But a terrifying roar fills the cave.[/p]

[p]“Come with me.” The wizard leads you to a large room filled with dusty bookcases and magical equipment. He seats himself at a table and stares into a crystal ball.[/p] [p]“I'm thinking of a time-travel device,” says the wizard. “It's a black cuckoo clock. A door in the center of the clock contains a mechanical bird.”[/p] [p]The wizard's green eyes seem to give off sparks.[/p] [p]“Here is the question: How do you make time run backward? Do you pull the bird out of the door and put it back three times? Or do you twist its head around? Think carefully before you answer,” he adds. “If you give a wrong answer you will be sent to the Corridors of Time – forever.”[/p]
p.next: Do you pull the bird out and put it back three times?
Or do you twist its head around?

p.text: [p]You've got to stop the truck – that's the only way to save your family. Quickly you push the button on the chronometer. But a moment later you're on the same New York City street.[/p] [p]Uh-oh. Maybe the chronometer didn't work![/p] [p]Then you notice a tall billboard with a digital clock and calendar. It's the same day, all right, but an hour earlier.[/p] [p]Whew. For now your family is safe. But you have to track down the truck and make sure nothing happens.[/p] [p]You remember seeing HERRING BROS, DELIVERIES on the truck's side panel. Quickly you look up the number and address in a phone book. Herring Bros, is only a few blocks away.[/p]

[p]You whirl around.[/p] [p]Whew! At least it's a human, and not a robot,[/p] [p]“Welcome to The City, stranger,” the human says. “Who are you?”[/p] [p]“I'm a traveler from the past,” you explain. “I'm looking for my brother.”[/p] [p]“You won't find him here,” the stranger replies. “It's not safe to be on the streets. Come with me.”[/p] [p]“But who are you?” you stammer.[/p] [p]“Later!” he whispers. “We've got to hide!” He leads you to the corner, then down a manhole into an underground tunnel. It's dark, and you can hear water dripping all around you.[/p] [p]The tunnel leads to a large room lit with candles and lanterns. Several other humans are inside.[/p] [p]“Welcome to the rebel stronghold,” says the man. “I'm Jarmal, leader of the rebellion.”[/p] [p]Rebellion? What's this guy talking about?[/p]

[p]The girl is gone![/p] [p]“Jackson,” the teacher goes on, as if nothing has happened. “What is 43,000,000 divided by 7.645328?”[/p] [p]A tall, pale boy stands up. He doesn't answer for a moment, then shakes his head. “I don't know,” he says.[/p] [p]“Go into the frammilizer!” the robot commands.[/p] [p]Slowly, Jackson walks to the front of the room. He steps into the box. A moment later he, too, is gone. Frammilized.[/p] [p]You watch in horror as your classmates disappear, one by one. In a moment it will be your turn. You've got to do something and do it fast![/p] [p]You could use the chronometer to leave the future, but you haven't found Denny![/p] [p]On the other hand, you've always done well in school – maybe you'll be able to answer the teacher's question.[/p]

[p]“I'm sorry,” you tell Jarmal. “I hope the humans win over the robots. But I've got to go look for my brother.”[/p] [p]“That's bad news – for you, ”Jarmal says. “But it's good news for us. We've been looking for someone to use as bait to lure the robots into the underground tunnels.”[/p] [p]“Wait a minute!” you say. “I've changed my mind! I want to join the rebel –”[/p] [p]“Sorry,” Jarmal replies. “It's too late.” He snatches the chronometer and crushes it beneath his boots.[/p] [p]“But I'm a fellow human!” you protest, as Jarmal and two other humans drag you back to the manhole.[/p] [p]“It makes no difference,” Jarmal snarls. “If there's one thing five hundred years of robot rule has taught us, it's not to be sentimental.”[/p] [p]The rebels tie you to the top of the manhole. Then Jarmal and his friends gather below, their guns drawn and ready. Outside on the street you can hear gunfire – and it's getting closer.[/p] [p]When the robots arrive, you'll be caught between the two opposing armies. Too bad. It looks as if you've gotten tied up in one adventure too many![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]The high, wooden door to the castle stands open. “Hello?” you call. “Is anybody home?”[/p] [p]Your own voice echoes back. You step through the door into a dark entrance hall. Hanging from the wall is a tapestry. In the center there's a picture of a fierce-looking beast.[/p] [p]A lion? you wonder. You sure hope you don't run into him here![/p] [p]You enter a winding, narrow corridor. Empty suits of armor line the walls. The only light comes from flickering candles.[/p] [p]The corridor turns and twists, but doesn't seem to lead anywhere. You glance at the chronometer. Only one hour left – and there's still no sign of Denny![/p] [p]Then all the candles go out.[/p] [p]You're in total darkness![/p] [p]From somewhere up ahead, you hear an eerie scream. A human scream. Chills creep up your spine. Who was that? Maybe you should get out of here right now.[/p] [p]But what if it was Denny?[/p]
p.next: If you chose to go on
If you decide to turn back

p.text: [p]Terrified, you reach up to help your brother. Your hand brushes a thick, ropelike strand. You try to pull back in disgust, but your hand is stuck. You raise your other hand to help. And your other hand gets stuck, too![/p] [p]“Denny!” you cry. “I'm trapped!”[/p] [p]“Here it comes!” Denny shrieks in terror.[/p] [p]The glowing red lights move slowly toward you. They're not lights – they're eyes … the eyes of the gigantic spider that made the web.[/p] [p]And it's the biggest spider you've ever seen![/p] [p]With huge, dripping fangs.[/p] [p]Frantically you struggle against the sticky strands, but it's no use. This time you've become totally wrapped up in your adventure![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]What would make you and Denny turn around? you wonder. You've got to create a distraction.[/p] [p]You glance at the newsstand again, and an idea comes to you. It's not much – but it's the only thing you can think of.[/p] [p]Quickly, you check your pockets. You've got about thirty dollars – your allowance, plus some money your dad gave you to buy souvenirs.[/p] [p]You ask the newsstand owner for change. You get a bunch of bills and coins. Suddenly a familiar-looking, red-haired boy runs past you. You stare at him, then glance back at your family. Denny is still with the rest of the family – what's he doing here, too?[/p] [p]“Denny!” you shout. “What are you doing here?”[/p]

[p]“It's King Henry's army!” King Ruthbert shouts.[/p] [p]The king's two knights spring into action. They drop you and jump in front of the king. They desperately try to defend him against the invading army.[/p] [p]When the knights let you go, you roll out of the way. You've got to grab Denny and get out of here. Fast![/p] [p]But one of King Henry's knights has already seized your brother. You watch in horror as the knight lifts your brother over his head and walks him over to the end of the castle.[/p] [p]Oh, no! The knight's about to toss Denny over the side![/p] [p]You've got to do something, but what? For just a moment you think about doing nothing. After all, Denny was planning to have you boiled in oil. But no – he's your brother, after all.[/p] [p]Your hands are still tied behind your back. Maybe you can trick the knight into letting Denny go. Or – maybe you can roll into the knight's path before he reaches the edge of the roof.[/p]

[p]You push open the door and step into the power room. You can feel the hot green glow from the power source on your skin. You place the red box next to the glowing orb and get ready to run.[/p] [p]Just as you reach the door, it slams shut![/p] [p]Oh, no. It's locked![/p] [p]Through a window you can see a robot guard on the other side. It's laughing at you![/p] [p]Desperately you reach for the chronometer. But the device turns white-hot and starts to melt in your hands! Somehow the pulsing glow is destroying it![/p] [p]You push and pull on the door again, but it won't budge.[/p] [p]The explosive device is programmed to go off within one minute. That minute is nearly up. Maybe the rebels will be able to help -[/p] [p][em]BOOM!!![/em] [/p] [p]Maybe not …[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]Frantically you pull the vine out of your path and race to the exit. The plant sends tendrils racing after you. They snap at your ankles.[/p] [p]A cluster of geraniums twists and turns toward you. As you approach, one of them sprays a bubbling pink solution at you. You skid in the slimy liquid and fall down.[/p] [p]Up ahead a giant cucumber plant hurls its fruit. You duck as a grapevine fires off hard green grapes.[/p] [p]HELP! You're being attacked by plants![/p] [p]You scramble to your feet and barely make it to the exit. You fall into the corridor outside.[/p]

[p]“I'll look for my brother in the past,” you tell Dr. Peebles.[/p] [p]“Fine,” the scientist replies. He punches another set of numbers into the computer.[/p] [p]“Now step right through the Chronoport,” Dr. Peebles instructs you. “And good luck.”[/p] [p]You approach the shimmering frame and enter it. You feel a strange tingling sensation. Everything appears hazy, as if you are underwater. A second later you see two paths ahead in the mist.[/p] [p]Wow![/p] [p]At the end of the left-hand path you squint to see a tall stone castle in the distance. A knight in shiny armor on a white horse rides toward it.[/p] [p]At the end of the right-hand path there's a swamp with tall, strange-looking trees towering over it. Moving among the trees is … can it be? A dinosaur![/p] [p]Which path did your brother choose? Which one will you take? Quick, decide![/p]
p.next: If you think Denny ran toward the knight
If you think he checked out the dinosaur

p.text: [p]You step between the bookcases and find yourself in a small, dark cave filled with piles of straw. The air is damp and smells terrible.[/p] [p]In one corner there's a dent in the straw, as if a very large animal has been lying there. Next to the dent is a pile of bones with teeth marks in them.[/p] [p]“Denny?” you call nervously. “Denny, are you in here?”[/p] [p]“Help me!” A sudden, faint voice fills the cave. It's your brother. “Help me!” he cries again.[/p] [p]The voice seems to be coming from the back of the little cave. You crawl farther back and see several piles of straw and a small opening. You press your eye up to the opening and peer inside. In the darkness, several tiny red lights glow.[/p] [p]“Help!” Denny's voice sounds fainter and more terrified.[/p] [p]But where is he? Is he hiding behind one of the piles of straw? Or did he go through the opening?[/p] [p]Make a decision quickly. Time is running out![/p]
p.next: If you crawl through the opening with the red lights
If you stay in the cave

p.text: [p]You walk over to the loading area, hoping you'll be able to convince someone to stop the green truck. But how?[/p] [p]“What are you doing daydreaming?” Abe bellows. He's a huge scary man. “Start loading, NOW.”[/p] [p]You lift the first crate. It's heavy, but you manage to hoist it into the back of the truck. That wasn't so bad – it's the next thirty or so that wear you out.[/p] [p]Your back is breaking, but every time you stop – even for a second – Abe is there saying “Load!” So you keep an eye on the green truck as you load.[/p] [p]To your horror, you see the driver of the green truck climbing into the front seat and getting ready to go. You've got to stop him! You start to run over to him, but Abe is coming around the corner. Can you get away from Abe? That's a matter of luck. Are you wearing something green today?[/p]

[p]“What?” you cry. You stare at the scientist. Your parents are going to ground you for life if you lose Denny.[/p] [p]“You'll have to travel in time to find him,” Dr. Peebles tells you. “I'd better make those adjustments to the Chronoport so you don't disappear into timelessness, too!”[/p] [p]You stare at the scientist as he fiddles with the time machine. You can't believe it – this guy is really serious![/p] [p]“When you find your brother,” Dr. Peebles goes on, “you must be touching each other before you use the chronometer. Otherwise, the device will bring only one of you back.”[/p] [p]“No problem,” you say. “But where did Denny go? The future or the past?”[/p] [p]“There's no way to know whether he's gone forward in time – or back,” Dr. Peebles replies. “You'll have to guess.”[/p] [p]You touch the chronometer around your neck. It began measuring real time the moment Denny disappeared. Already the seconds are ticking by. You have to decide: Are you more likely to find Denny in the past or in the future?[/p]

[p]The robot guard looks you up and down. You keep staring at his gun.[/p] [p]“The [em]romiframpton[/em],” you repeat.[/p] [p]“Broken again?” the guard replies. “Go on in. You know where it is.”[/p] [p]Actually, you [em]don't[/em] have any idea where the romiframpton is. But you don't care. You're in![/p] [p]A steel walkway leads straight ahead. Next to it, a ladder stretches up.[/p] [p]Which way is the power source?[/p]

[p]As soon as you place the red box against the wall, it begins ticking. Jarmal said you'd have one minute to escape from the power plant. That's not enough time to make it down the ladder! Then you spot a small door behind the ladder, labeled EMERGENCY EXIT.[/p] [p]You throw yourself toward the exit. You're in a slick chute that leads down. You slide toward the bottom, holding your breath. Will you make it before the plant blows?[/p]

[p]“Wait!” you cry. “You don't need to –” But it's too late. He's already jumped into the water. You watch in horror as the crocodiles swim toward him – jaws open![/p] [p]“One last thing,” the knight calls before the beasts reach him. “Beware of the Lair!”[/p] [p]“The what?” you ask. But the only answer is the snapping of the crocodiles' jaws.[/p] [p]Trying not to watch or listen, you hurry across the drawbridge and into the castle.[/p]

[p]You decide to try to get out of this creepy castle. Using the wall to guide you through the darkness, you start back. You've only gone a few steps when you feel a doorknob with your fingers. You turn it and step into a smoky room filled with red light.[/p] [p]“Who's there?” calls a frightened-sounding woman. Before you can answer, she cries out, “Please help me!”[/p] [p]You make your way through the smoke toward the sound of her voice. At the back of the room, chained to the stone wall, is a beautiful blond woman. She's dressed in a flowing green gown.[/p] [p]“Help me!” she screams. “Find the key and unlock the chains before he comes back!”[/p] [p]“Before who comes back?” you ask.[/p] [p]“The dragon!” she says. “He went into his den to take a nap. You've got to save me!”[/p] [p]Now you see an opening in the wall. Smoke is pouring out of it with a hissing sound. This must be the dragon's den. You look at the chain holding the woman to the wall. The lock is a very strange shape – nearly round.[/p] [p]“Hurry!” she shrieks. “I hear the dragon returning!”[/p]

[p]The two knights drag you over to the pot of boiling oil. The king and Denny are right behind them.[/p] [p]“On the count of three, carry out the sentence!” the king orders.[/p] [p]“Denny, help!” you plead.[/p] [p]But Denny sticks his tongue out at you. Then he gives the king the thumbs-up sign.[/p] [p]“One!” the king says. The knights pick you up.[/p] [p]“Please – just listen to me –” you cry.[/p] [p]“Two!” The knights lift you high in the air above the pot.[/p] [p]Frantically, you struggle to free your hands, so you can use the chronometer. But they are tied too tightly.[/p] [p]“Three –” the king cries. At that moment, a hair-curling scream splits the air. Dozens of armored knights rush onto the roof. They're all waving swords and knives and holding out large shields. The roof is swarming with knights ready for battle![/p]

[p]You quickly jump up on the counter of the newsstand, and then climb onto the roof.[/p] [p]“Hey!” the owner shouts. “Get down from there!”[/p] [p]You ignore him. While he continues to yell, you take some of your money and throw it down on the sidewalk. “FREE MONEY!” you shout.[/p] [p]Down below, Denny shouts the same thing. “FREE MONEY!”[/p] [p]“Look at that!” someone shouts. “Those kids are throwing away money!”[/p] [p]Two or three passersby pick up coins and bills. A crowd starts to gather and cars and taxis brake to see what's going on.[/p] [p]You watch as Denny bends down and pockets some of the change.[/p] [p]“Denny!” you scream. “Put that –”[/p] [p]Loud honking starts up in the distance. The truck is coming! You can see it now – speeding for the intersection where your family is about to cross![/p]

[p]You glide through the mist toward the New York City street where you saw the red-haired boy. Honking taxis, buses, and trucks zip along the street. Tall buildings surround you. On the streets, people are shouting, arguing, and laughing.[/p] [p]Uh-oh. This looks exactly like New York City in the [em]present[/em] . Maybe something went wrong with the chronometer.[/p] [p]You glance around for the red-haired kid you saw. But you don't see him anywhere.[/p] [p]You approach a corner newsstand. “Excuse me,” you say to the vendor. “Can you tell me how to get to the Museum of Natural History?”[/p] [p]“What do I look like, an information booth?” he snaps back at you.[/p] [p]“Never mind,” you mutter. “Who needs your –”[/p] [p]Then you notice a stack of newspapers. The one on top has tomorrow's date. You're in the future all right – one crummy day in the future![/p] [p]No fair! you think. You're about to push the right-hand button on the chronometer to travel further into the future when something makes you gasp.[/p]

[p]You love the zoo! What a weird punishment, you think, as the police robot takes you away in a flying car.[/p] [p]Soon you zoom through the zoo gates. Giraffes, elephants, tigers, and antelopes roam around the grounds. Instead of bars, a shimmering transparent force field separates the animals from the viewers.[/p] [p]“You will remain here,” the robot announces, stopping in front of an exhibit that looks like a living room, with a couch, chairs, and a TV.[/p] [p]The robot yanks the chronometer off your neck.[/p] [p]“Give that back!” you shout, but the robot ignores you. It aims its laser gun at the force field around the exhibit. The field dissolves, and the robot pushes you into the exhibit.[/p] [p]“Wait a minute!” you protest. “You can't leave me here!”[/p] [p]“I'm sure you will be comfortable,” the robot tells you. It zaps its gun again, and the force field goes back up.[/p] [p]“No!” you cry, trying to push through the force field.[/p] [p]Then a group of robots approaches. Two little ones point and make strange coughing noises.[/p] [p]What are they pointing at?[/p]

[p]You decide your best chance for escape – and for finding Denny – is to go to the past.[/p] [p]The teacher finishes questioning the girl in front of you. Before the robot gets to you, you press the left-hand button on the chronometer. You feel a tingling sensation, and the classroom disappears.[/p] [p]The next thing you know, you are standing on a familiar-looking sidewalk. Across the street, a robot strolls along, looking in shop windows.[/p] [p]Is this the past? This is the same spot where the robot policeman picked you up![/p] [p]But it's nighttime now, you realize a minute later. You've traveled to the past, just not very far back.[/p] [p]You hear approaching footsteps and quickly duck into a doorway. You stay very, very still.[/p] [p]Then you feel a hand come down, hard, on your shoulder.[/p]

[p]You step through the door labeled TO THE LAIR. You find yourself in a very narrow passageway. Smoking candles along the walls give off a little light as the path twists and turns. You're beginning to wonder if you made the wrong choice when you see something on the path:[/p] [p]A squashed Gummi Bear.[/p] [p]Your heart stops. There were no Gummi Bears in medieval times. Denny's been here![/p] [p]You hurry along the corridor and see more squashed Gummi Bears. Your brother has definitely come this way. But where is he now?[/p] [p]You come to a narrow staircase. You follow the cold stone steps downward. At the bottom is a big, wooden door. Over it, a sign says LAIR OF THE WIZARD.[/p] [p]Next to that door is a tiny door about a foot high. The sign over the small door says LAIR OF THE LIZARD.[/p] [p]You think again about the knight's last words to you: “Beware of the Lair.” But which lair did he mean?[/p]
p.next: Approach the Lair of the Wizard
Check out the Lair of the Lizard

p.text: [p]You look over at your future family. The future Denny and the future you are laughing and pointing at the shower of money.[/p] [p]Your parents are watching, too. Then your father points to his watch and says something. The others nod and start for the corner again.[/p] [p]“No!” you shout.[/p] [p]A split second later, the green truck hurtles toward the crowded intersection. Brakes squeal and horns blare. You freeze, barely able to watch the scene unfolding in front of you.[/p] [p]Your mother lets out a blood-chilling scream.[/p] [p]Have you saved your family?[/p]

[p]In just a moment you'll be safe in another part of the future.[/p] [p]“Stand and answer!” the robot demands, pointing at you.[/p] [p]You stand. You're holding the chronometer with your finger on the right-hand button.[/p] [p]“What,” the robot asks, “is the quallicork of –”[/p] [p]You don't wait for the rest of the question. You press the button. You feel a tingling sensation, and the next instant …[/p] [p]You are still standing in the classroom and the robot is still speaking: “ – on the right-hand ad-jubibble in Jupiter?”[/p] [p]You press the button again, but you're still in the same place. Is the chronometer broken?[/p] [p]You glance at the dial while you press again. Now you see with horror that it is taking you into the future – but only five seconds at a time![/p]

[p]“Pull the bird out three times!” you cry.[/p] [p]“WRONG!” the wizard thunders. Instantly, there's a brilliant flash of light. You find yourself in a misty corridor. With a sinking feeling, you realize you are in the Corridors of Time.[/p] [p]In the distance you see an old man trudging along, with the help of a cane. You hurry to catch up. The man has a white beard and thinning gray hair. There's something familiar about him …[/p] [p]“Hi,” the old man says in a creaky voice.[/p] [p]It's Denny! Somehow the Corridors of Time have turned him into an old man![/p] [p]You grab his arm. “Denny,” you say, “come on. Maybe we can find a way out of here.”[/p] [p]He shakes off your hand. “You're not the boss of me,” he grumbles. Then he bops you on the head with his cane. “I'm older now – and I'm the boss of you!”[/p] [p]Too bad. You're stuck in time with your older younger brother![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You take off after your brother. But by the time you reach the tree where you last saw him, he's gone.[/p] [p]Then something on the ground near the tree catches your eye. It's the chronometer. But where's Denny? And why did he leave the chronometer behind?[/p] [p]You scoop up the device and run your finger over the buttons. Denny said he wanted to do something else. He was probably bored with the past and decided to go to the future.[/p] [p]You quickly press the button on the right and feel a tingling sensation.[/p] [p]A purple mist surrounds you. Everything turns blurry. You close your eyes, hoping your dizziness will pass.[/p] [p]You open your eyes again. And blink. Twice.[/p] [p]A futuristic-looking city looms in the distance.[/p]

[p]Are you serious? Would you [em]really[/em] rather look for your brother than take a trip in time? Well, then, you're reading the wrong book! GOOSEBUMPS readers only have time for adventure.[/p] [p]Take a minute and think it over … then go back to choose again![/p]

[p]You're heading over to the green truck when you feel Abe's heavy hand on your back. “Get in,” he says, shoving you into the back of the red truck. “You've got to unload at the other end.” He slams the door. You're locked in. There's no way you can help your family now.[/p] [p]You're squeezed in with all the boxes you loaded. Even though you loaded dozens of them, you never really looked at them. Some light is coming in from a crackjn the roof, so you can make out the address on the boxes: BROOKDALE LABORATORY.[/p] [p]Then you notice that there are small holes in the boxes. You put your eye right up against one of the holes and you see an eye staring back at you![/p] [p]Creepy.[/p]

[p]A hideous lion stands at the entrance to the cave. It's enormous – bigger than any lion you've seen at the zoo. Its head is covered with yellow-brown fur and a thick mane. Its eyes glitter as it looks you up and down.[/p] [p]Then you recognize the beast.[/p] [p]It's the lion from the tapestry in the entrance-way to the castle![/p] [p]In terror, Denny ducks behind you.[/p] [p]“You'll do just as well!” the creature snarls as it rushes toward you. It grabs you by the arm, licking its lips hungrily.[/p] [p]You glance at the chronometer in your hand. The lion is touching you, so if you press the chronometer buttons now it will travel to the future with you and Denny. But if you [em]don't[/em] go to the present soon, you and Denny will be lost forever.[/p] [p]Should you stay here? Or return to Dr. Peebles's laboratory with both Denny and the lion?[/p]
p.next: To stay and fight the lion

p.text: [p]The huge tyrannosaur towers over the other dinosaurs. It's bigger than you ever imagined. Its teeth are as long and sharp as carving knives.[/p] [p]The enormous creature lets out a roar as it crosses the grassy plain. You freeze. Your heart pounds in terror.[/p] [p]The other dinosaurs all start to run away. But one, who was grazing on ferns, is slower than the others. The tyrannosaur easily catches up to it, and tears off the small dinosaur's head in one bite![/p] [p]Then the tyrannosaur swings its head and stares straight at you! You take off as fast as you can. The tyrannosaur follows. Closer and closer.[/p] [p]Ahead there's a swampy patch of land. You race toward it. Something small is sitting in the middle of the swamp.[/p] [p]It's Denny![/p] [p]But what's he doing? Why isn't he moving?[/p] [p]You glance back over your shoulder. The dinosaur is still right behind you.[/p] [p]“Denny!” you call out. “Run!”[/p] [p]“I can't,” he yells back. “I'm stuck in quicksand!”[/p]

[p]A tingling sensation races through your body as you're transported back to the present and the Museum of Natural History. When the misty air clears, you're back in the time exhibit, standing near a sundial.[/p] [p]“Come on,” you say to Denny, sighing with relief. “Let's go find Mom and Dad.”[/p] [p]“No way,” two voices reply in stereo. “You're not the boss of me.”[/p] [p]“Oh, no,” you moan out loud as you realize what you've done.[/p] [p]Both Dennys have returned to the present with you![/p] [p]You've saved your brother's life, but ruined your own.[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You've got to hit the brakes. The truck is speeding along even faster than before. You try to reach the brake pedal with your foot – but you can't reach![/p] [p]With horror you watch as your family steps into the intersection. You dive down to the floor of the truck. Using both hands, you push on the brake pedal as hard as you can.[/p] [p][em]SCREEEEEECH!!!![/em] [/p] [p]Will it stop?[/p]

[p]You get ready to make your escape from the classroom. You need to find your brother before his time runs out, but it's too dangerous to stay here.[/p] [p]Now the robot is questioning the girl sitting in front of you. While she stammers out an answer, you grasp the chronometer.[/p] [p]Where should you go? Do you think you might find Denny in a time farther in the future? Or perhaps he's in the past? Maybe you should return to Dr. Peebles's laboratory and ask his help in finding your brother.[/p] [p]Whatever you decide to do, choose now! The teacher is about to question [em]you[/em] ![/p]
p.next: Return to the laboratory for Dr. Peebles's help?
Seek Denny farther in the future?
Or look for him in the past?

p.text: [p]You lean against the wall of the corridor, trying to calm yourself. The only person who can help you find Denny is Dr. Peebles. You pull the chronometer from under your uniform and press the top and bottom buttons to return to his laboratory. You've got to escape before anyone – or anything – comes after you again.[/p] [p]But nothing happens.[/p] [p]You press the buttons again, and nothing happens.[/p] [p]Oh, no.[/p] [p]What will you do now? You glance up and notice the sign pointing to TELETIME. Maybe it has something to do with time travel. Maybe there's another way to get back to the present.[/p]

[p]As you back away from the vicious flower, its curling vine sends out new shoots.[/p] [p]Beyond the plant you see a sign marked EXIT. Can you get around the vine and make your escape?[/p] [p]Or, off to your right is a rack of garden tools. You see a long rake that looks pretty sharp. Maybe you'd better get the rake first and fight off the vine.[/p] [p]Quick! Make a decision! Will you grab the rake first? Or run straight for the door?[/p]
p.next: To try to go through the exit

p.text: [p]“I'm ready to travel through time!” you tell Dr. Peebles.[/p] [p]“Good,” the white-haired man replies. He punches some numbers into the computer keyboard. The computer starts to hum. The square doorway between the clock and the computer fills with a strange, shimmering glow. “The Chrono-port is almost ready,” the scientist says, pointing to the frame. “I only need to adjust –”[/p] [p]But before he can continue, you hear pounding footsteps. You turn to see Denny racing toward you.[/p] [p]“Denny!” you cry. He's heading straight for the Chronoport. “You can't go in there!”[/p] [p]“You're not the boss of me!” Denny yells. He runs straight through the glowing frame. There's a soft [em]pop[/em] before he disappears completely.[/p] [p]“Oh, no!” Dr. Peebles cries. “He went before I made the final settings! If you don't bring him back within two hours of real time, he'll disappear into timelessness forever!”[/p]

[p]You grab Denny's hand and press the chronometer buttons to escape.[/p] [p]Nothing happens.[/p] [p]“What's going on?” Denny whines, tugging at your arm.[/p] [p]“I don't know,” you snap.[/p] [p]You let go of Denny's hand and stare closely at the face of the chronometer. It looks okay. Same as always. You wonder what went wrong.[/p] [p]Then the lion roars. Loudly![/p] [p]You shake the chronometer up and down. And try pressing the buttons again. Your body starts to tingle.[/p] [p]It's working! you think. You shut your eyes tightly. Your fingertips tingle with what feels like an electric current.[/p] [p]You open your eyes. You can't believe it! You're not back in Dr. Peebles's lab. You're still in the castle. In front of a door that says KING RUTHBERT'S THRONE ROOM.[/p] [p]The lion is gone. But where is Denny?[/p] [p]And then you remember – you didn't hold Denny's hand. You've lost him all over again! And time's running out![/p]

[p]Frantically you start to press the other button, for the past. The robot rolls over to your side. It grabs the chronometer away from you. “No playing with toys during class!” it shouts. “Now answer the question!”[/p] [p]You have no idea what quallicorks or adjubib-bles are. And you don't think you'll have time to find out. Too bad – but it looks as if the answer to your question this time is:[/p] [p class="end"]TIME'S UP[/p]

[p]You follow the purple sign and rush into the Engine Room area. It's crammed with machinery and monitor screens. At the center is a control panel with banks of blinking lights. Next to the control panel is a clear plastic chamber, about the size of a car, labeled ANTIGRAV.[/p] [p]Inside the chamber is a small figure that's floating and turning in midair.[/p] [p]It's Denny! You yank open the door. “Denny!” you call. “We've got to get back to the present right now!”[/p] [p]“I don't want to,” he whines.[/p] [p]You step into the chamber, but your feet don't touch the floor. There's no gravity here – you're weightless! You get a funny feeling in your stomach as you start to float around.[/p] [p]You grab for your brother – but he easily twists away. You find yourself upside down. If you weren't so worried about returning to your own time, this would be fun. “Come on, Denny!” you beg.[/p] [p]“You're not the boss of me.” He sneers at you.[/p] [p]You grab for him again – and miss. Then you glance outside the chamber – a robot guard has his laser gun pointed straight at you.[/p]

[p]An instant later, you find yourself back in the laboratory at the Museum of Natural History.[/p] [p]“Welcome back.” Dr. Peebles looks relieved to see both you and Denny. “How was your trip?”[/p] [p]“Exciting,” you say.[/p] [p]“Boring,” Denny whines. He punches you. “I'm hungry!”[/p] [p]You gaze at your brother with exasperation. You know that if it weren't for you, he would have disappeared forever. You think of everything you had to go through to save him. And for just a moment, you wonder if it was such a good idea.[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]The screams echo against the dark walls. You wish you could turn around and get out of here. But you have to find your brother.[/p] [p]“Denny?” you shout.[/p] [p]You put your hand on the walls to guide you. A light appears up ahead, and you follow it into a circular room.[/p] [p]Inside the room are three doors. You just came through one of them. The other two are labeled TO KING RUTHBERT'S THRONE ROOM and TO THE LAIR.[/p] [p]You remember that the knight warned you to “Beware of the Lair.” Did he mean this lair?[/p] [p]What about the Throne Room? Judging by this spooky castle, that could be pretty dangerous, too.[/p] [p]Which door do you choose?[/p]

[p]Strolling down the block in front of you is a familiar-looking family: a father, a mother, and two kids. There's a very good reason why the family looks so familiar. It's [em]your[/em] family.[/p] [p]You watch as your Mom, Dad, Denny, and [em]you[/em] continue down the block. Your parents are talking to each other, and you and Denny seem to be arguing – some things will never change.[/p] [p]You watch as Denny gives you a karate chop in the arm, and you punch him back.[/p] [p]It feels so strange to watch yourself like this. There are two of you in the same place! What would happen if you spoke to your future self?[/p] [p]You still haven't decided what to do when your family reaches the corner. The light changes and they start to cross to the other side of the street.[/p] [p]A moment later you hear frightened screams and shouts, and then loud honking. You turn toward the noise. A green truck is speeding down the street.[/p] [p]The truck shows no sign of slowing down, and it's headed straight toward your family![/p]

[p]“Yeah, get out of here!” Denny adds. A karate chop lands on your arm.[/p] [p]You can't help it. You punch him back. “Don't be a jerk!” you say. “Turn around now! If you don't, something terrible will happen!”[/p] [p]“You're not the boss of me!” Denny yells. He rushes toward the intersection.[/p] [p]“Stop!” you yell again. Denny turns around and kicks you, hard, in the shin. You are so mad you grab him in a headlock. “Say you're sorry!” you yell.[/p] [p]“You're not the boss of me!” Denny screams again.[/p] [p]This time the other you jumps into the fight. While you hold on to Denny's neck, the you from the future pokes him in the chest.[/p] [p]“Say you're sorry,” you demand, tightening your hold on his neck. “Say it.”[/p] [p]This time you don't even see the truck bearing down on you and your family. It's too much fun having two of you to gang up on Denny![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You decide to sneak in through the air duct. Jarmal leads you through the trees to the back of the power plant. The air duct is a small opening near ground level. Slipping the red box of explosives under your shirt, you climb into the opening. Then you begin to inch your way along the duct.[/p] [p]The duct is so small you can scarcely move. As you go farther in, the space becomes even tighter. You crawl another foot – then realize you are stuck! You can't go forward, and you .can't go back. And your hands are trapped at your sides. You can't reach the explosives or the chronometer.[/p] [p]You are about to yell for help when you hear shouting outside.[/p] [p][em]Whump![/em] [/p] [p]Laser guns fire. The robots must have found the rebels![/p] [p]“The small human is in the air duct, Commander!” a robot says. “We'll close the air duct so it can't breathe!”[/p] [p][em]CLANG![/em] [/p] [p]The cover of the air duct bangs shut.[/p] [p]Looks like you've picked the wrong side in this battle, human. Sadly, your adventure has come to a breathtaking[/p] [p class="end"]END[/p]

[p]You tear down the corridor to the Hydroponics area.[/p] [p]What a jungle! Thick, green leaves and winding vines creep all around the room. Strange-looking plants grow everywhere. You notice they're all potted in a pink solution that is bubbling furiously.[/p] [p]You watch the doorway as you look around. The robots may catch up to you at any minute.[/p] [p]“Denny!” you call. “Are you in here?”[/p] [p]You wander past odd-shaped leaves, strange-smelling flowers, and heavy, colorful fruits. You've never seen anything like them. You wonder if something in outer space caused ordinary earth plants to mutate into strange new forms.[/p] [p]You come to a large sign that reads DANGER.[/p] [p]Huh? What could be dangerous in a room of plants?[/p] [p]Then you see it: a vine with a stem as thick as an elephant's leg. Its flower is huge, with sharp-looking petals.[/p] [p]You step forward for a closer look. Suddenly the flower lunges at you, its petals snapping shut an inch from your nose![/p]

[p]You follow the sign to Teletime. It's a spacious room full of electronic equipment. A large panel in the center of the room contains dozens of TV monitors.[/p] [p]On the monitors you can see several scenes from the past: Alexander the Great's army, the signing of the Declaration of Independence, the landing on the moon. A robot in a white lab coat watches the monitors and doesn't notice you.[/p] [p]Maybe the robot can help you return to your own time. You're about to ask for help when an alarm sounds.[/p] [p]“ATTENTION ALL PERSONNEL!” a loudspeaker squawks. “BE ON THE LOOKOUT FOR AN INTRUDER!”[/p] [p]The robot scientist whirls around and spots you. He pulls out a laser gun. “Explain yourself!”[/p] [p]What do you do now? Tell the truth and ask the robot for help? Or try to trick it?[/p]

[p]“I know the answer,” you tell the wizard. “To make time run backward, you have to twist the head of the cuckoo.”[/p] [p]The wizard waves his arms. A moment later there is a brilliant flash of light and the wizard disappears. In his place stands Denny.[/p] [p]You never thought you'd be so glad to see your little brother.[/p] [p]“Denny!” you cry. “I've been looking all over for you!”[/p] [p]“I've been [em]hiding[/em] from [em]you[/em] !” he replies.[/p] [p]You glance at the chronometer. Now there's less than thirty minutes till your two hours are up. “Denny,” you tell him, “we've got to go back to Dr. Peebles's laboratory. We've got to go [em]now[/em] –”[/p] [p]“You're not the boss of me!” he exclaims.[/p] [p]“Come on!” you insist. You reach for his hand, but he yanks it away.[/p] [p]“I don't want to go!” he cries. He runs into the mist and disappears at the back of the Lair.[/p]

[p]You step through a door labeled TO KING RUTHBERT'S THRONE ROOM and climb a short flight of steps. At the top, you enter a huge stone room.[/p] [p]Colorful tapestries hang on the walls between narrow, arch-shaped windows. Ladies in long gowns sit on wooden benches. Around the room, knights in armor stand stiffly at attention.[/p] [p]At the far end of the room, a wooden throne stands on a raised platform. Sitting on the throne is a fat, bearded man wearing a red robe and gold crown.[/p] [p]King Ruthbert, you realize.[/p] [p]Next to him, on a smaller throne, is a small person. His crown is too big and slips down over his face.[/p] [p]A nearby knight draws his sword and raises it to your throat. The sword lightly pricks your skin.[/p] [p]“What are you doing here, stranger?” the knight demands.[/p] [p]“I'm a traveler from the future,” you quickly explain. “I'm looking for my brother. He has red hair and –”[/p] [p]“Silence!” the knight shouts. “I'll not listen to any more of your lies! You're a spy for King Henry!”[/p]

[p]As you reach for a weapon, you notice an apple tree planted alongside the moat. Suddenly you have an idea – and it's just what you need to put a chink in this knight's armor.[/p] [p]“I choose the club,” you tell the knight. “But we'll duel according to my rules.”[/p] [p]“Very well, stranger,” the knight says. He hands you the club.[/p] [p]“See that apple tree?” you say. “Pick one of the apples and toss it toward me. I'll hit the apple with the club. Then I'll throw an apple for you to hit. Whoever hits the apple farthest will win the duel.”[/p] [p]“A strange challenge indeed,” the knight grumbles. “But I accept.”[/p] [p]Last year you were the best batter on your baseball team. Now you're hoping your batting average will pay off. Can you beat the knight at baseball?[/p] [p][img src="../resources/flick.jpg" /] [img src="../resources/flick.jpg" /][/p]

[p]The knights drag you to a platform above the pot of boiling oil. With a gulp you look down into the seething black fluid. In another second you'll be sizzling like fried chicken![/p] [p]You twist your hands behind your back. But the ropes are too tight to break through.[/p] [p]The king and Denny climb up to the roof to watch.[/p] [p]“Do you have any last words, spy?” the king asks.[/p] [p]“Yes!” you say. “Please let me take Denny … er … your son away from here. If he stays he's doomed!”[/p] [p]“Never!” the king roars. “Prepare to carry out the sentence!”[/p] [p]“Denny!” you plead. “You can't let him do this! You've got to listen to me! Tell him not to do it!”[/p]

[p]You've got to warn your family. “Stop!” you cry as you dash across the street. “Go back to the hotel!”[/p] [p]At first they all ignore you. Then your mom's eyes grow wide. She looks back and forth between you and the other you.[/p] [p]“I don't have time to explain what's happening!” you shout at her. “Don't cross the street! Mom, please! It's dangerous!”[/p] [p]But now your family is hurrying to get away from you. They're totally freaked out![/p] [p]“Stop!” you cry again.[/p] [p]“I don't know who you are or why you're pretending to be my child,” your father says angrily. “But if you don't leave us alone, I'm calling the police!”[/p] [p]“Please!” you beg. “Just stop for a minute! You have to listen to me! I'm trying to save your –”[/p] [p]“I mean it,” your dad says. “Get out of here or you'll be sorry!”[/p]

[p]The truck picks up speed as it approaches the corner. There's no way your family can get out of the way.[/p] [p]In another moment they will be flattened like pancakes, and there's nothing you can do![/p] [p]But maybe …[/p] [p]You touch the chronometer. Maybe you can go back in time and stop the accident before it happens.[/p] [p]Should you go back in the past a few minutes and try to stop your family? Or go back farther in time and try to stop the truck?[/p]

[p]The knight uses his sharp sword to slash the ropes around your arms. You're free![/p] [p]Before the knight can question you further, you jump up and karate kick the sword from his hand.[/p] [p]The sword falls to the ground. You can't believe the karate lessons you took last summer worked! You karate kick the knight again.[/p] [p]And lose your balance.[/p] [p]You reach out and grab Denny and tumble to the ground, hitting a button on the chronometer.[/p] [p]You sprawl on the ground, dizzy. And then you hear it. “All hail the king! All hail the king!”[/p] [p]You gaze up and gasp. You're in a strange land. And hundreds of people are chanting and bowing. Bowing to [em]you[/em] ![/p] [p]You are the king![/p] [p]You stand up and give your first order. “Take this slave boy away,” you say, pointing at Denny. “I [em]am[/em] the boss now.”[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You follow the robot into a big, glass-walled building. He leads you to a courtroom. A shiny robot dressed in black sits behind a tall desk.[/p] [p]The judge, you realize.[/p] [p]“You are accused of appearing in the streets, human,” the judge says. “How do you plead?”[/p] [p]“Guilty, Your Honor,” you say. “But I didn't –”[/p] [p]“Silence!” the judge cuts you off. “There are no excuses. For punishment, you may have your choice: You will be sentenced to school or to the zoo.”[/p] [p]School? The zoo? What kind of punishment is this? To find out, make a choice now.[/p]

[p]“A red-haired boy is visiting the space station,” you tell the robot. “Can your machine find him?”[/p] [p]“Of course,” the robot says, twisting some dials.[/p] [p]Denny's face ripples across the screen. He's crouched underneath a table that holds a large computer. As you stare at your brother you realize the table is in this very room![/p] [p]“Denny!” you cry. You run toward the table. Denny is still huddled there, too scared to move or speak.[/p] [p]Swiftly, you duck past the robot and under the desk.[/p] [p]“No!” the robot cries, coming after you. But you grab your brother's hand, then press the top and bottom buttons on the chronometer. As Dr. Peebles instructed, you hold them down for five seconds.[/p]

[p]You roll right into the knight's path.[/p] [p]“EEEYOW!” the knight cries as you hit him hard. He falls over backward, and Denny sails out of his arms.[/p] [p]Denny cries out as he hits the roof. But he immediately scrambles to his feet.[/p] [p]“Quick!” you tell Denny. “Untie my hands! We've got to get out of here!”[/p] [p]“You're not the boss of me!” Denny says. But for once he actually does what you say.[/p] [p]Now the knight is on his feet again, his eyes burning with rage.[/p] [p]“I'll destroy both of you!” he bellows. He lunges for you and your brother.[/p]

[p]You crawl through the small opening. In the darkness the red lights glitter like jewels.[/p] [p]Sticky, ropelike strands hang from the walls and ceiling. At the end of each strand there's a big gray lump.[/p] [p]You move closer to the strands and shudder.[/p] [p]The strands are part of a big spiderweb! And the big gray lumps are the bodies of giant insects![/p] [p]“Help me!” a voice cries out.[/p] [p]As you stare at the web you realize one of the wrapped-up insects is much larger than the others.[/p] [p]“Help me!”[/p] [p]It's Denny! A giant spider has wrapped him up in its silk![/p]

[p]You take off after the knight on horseback. The enormous stone castle stretches toward the sky. Flags fly from its turrets.[/p] [p]You imagine living there. Cool! you think.[/p] [p]Suddenly you notice that the knight has disappeared. Where did he go?[/p] [p]You hurry over a drawbridge, which stretches over a moat. The moat surrounds the castle.[/p] [p]The sound of thundering hooves breaks the silence. The knight is returning, at full speed. And now he's holding a spear – and pointing it at you![/p] [p]“Hey!” you call out. “I'm not your enemy! I'm a visitor from the future!”[/p] [p]But the knight doesn't pay attention. His horse gallops closer and closer. The tip of the knight's spear gleams in the sun.[/p] [p]Uh-oh. This guy looks pretty serious. Are you ready to face him? Or should you jump into the moat below, even though you're a terrible swimmer?[/p]

[p]Quickly, you pull the chronometer from around your neck and put it in the keyhole.[/p] [p]“RRAAAOOORRRGGGHHH!” the dragon bellows, filling the small room with flames and more smoke.[/p] [p]The woman shrieks in terror. You turn the chronometer in the lock. To your surprise, the lock pops open. The woman quickly pulls off her chains, then grabs your hand. “This way!” she cries. “The dragon can't follow!”[/p] [p]She leads you through a small door and slams it. Behind the door, the dragon roars angrily.[/p] [p]“Thank you for saving me,” the woman says. “Is there any way I can repay you?”[/p] [p]You explain that you're looking for your brother. “He has red hair,” you say, describing him.[/p] [p]The woman nods. “I've seen a young boy who looks just like that in the Throne Room.” She points to a door labeled TO KING RUTHBERT'S THRONE ROOM.[/p] [p]You glance at the chronometer. Time is running out! You've got only half an hour to find Denny and return to the present.[/p] [p]“Good luck.” The woman smiles. “And thanks again.”[/p]

[p]You yank your hand away from the lion. To your surprise, it lets you go. But just as you are about to press the buttons on the chronometer, the lion pounces on your brother, knocking you both over.[/p] [p]The chronometer flies out of your hand. At the same moment, there's a loud [em]pop[/em] ! Denny disappears into the air. With a squeak of surprise, the lion disappears, too![/p] [p]You look all around, but there's no sign of either your brother or the beast. And the chronometer lies smashed on the floor.[/p] [p]Oh, no! Now you've done it. Maybe the wizard can help you.[/p] [p]You wander back through the castle, trying to find the wizard's lair. At last you come to the door labeled: LAIR OF THE WIZARD.[/p]

[p]You press the button under your middle finger and immediately feel a tingling sensation. When it stops, you're standing near small trees. In the distance long-necked dinosaurs are grazing on some plants.[/p] [p]Dinosaurs! How far back in time have you gone? You don't have time to think about it when Denny says, “Look at these weird rocks!”[/p] [p]Denny's standing next to six round, speckled boulders. They're not rocks, you realize. They're eggs. Dinosaur eggs! As you stare at the rocks, you hear a steady tapping sound. Then one of them begins to crack.[/p] [p]“Wow!” you cry. “I think this egg's about to hatch!”[/p] [p]“I want to do something else,” Denny whines. “I'm bored.” He grabs the chronometer and runs off.[/p] [p]“Denny, come back!” you scream. But he keeps running.[/p] [p]You're going to have to go after him. But if you do, you'll miss the coolest thing that's happened since you got here. What should you do?[/p]

[p]The squealing of brakes fills the air. The truck lurches to a stop right before your family.[/p] [p][em]CRASH![/em] [/p] [p]A taxicab slams into the back of the truck. Horns blare and several drivers jump from their cars as a horrible stench fills the air.[/p] [p]What's going on?[/p] [p]You leap out of the truck and run around to the back. Luckily, the driver of the taxi is fine, but the truck's back doors have been smashed in. And now a river of dead, slippery fish is flowing out of the back, onto the taxicab's hood, and into the street.[/p] [p]P.U.![/p] [p]You grab the chronometer and push down on the buttons.[/p] [p]You're sorry about leaving Denny behind in the future, but, as he always says – you're not the boss of him.[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]
