[p]The space shuttle finally docks at a huge, orbiting space station. The doors ghde open. You walk off the shuttle and enter a corridor.[/p] [p]Inside the space station, robots and humans hurry along the walkway. Denny might be here somewhere – but where?[/p] [p]A pair of robots wearing security badges stare right at you. All the other humans are wearing bright yellow uniforms, you notice. You'd better find one right away, before someone tries to stop you.[/p] [p]Just ahead is a door marked SUPPLIES. Inside, a pile of freshly laundered uniforms sits on a shelf.[/p]

[p]You're sure you can trick the robot. After all, you're human and he's just a machine.[/p] [p]“Please don't shoot me,” you cry. “I'm a visitor from the past. I'm only here to find my brother.”[/p] [p]The robot hesitates. It seems to be computing what you just said. Then it pulls back the trigger on its laser.[/p] [p]“I could prove it if you had better technology,” you add.[/p] [p]The robot's electronic eye flashes angrily. “Our technology has been perfected,” it states.[/p] [p]“Too bad.” You heave a big sigh. “I mean, you probably can't locate the time I left the present.”[/p] [p]The robot scuttles over. “When did you leave?” it demands. “I can find that!”[/p] [p]You tell the robot the exact day and time that you left Dr. Peebles's laboratory.[/p] [p]The robot adjusts some controls. Then Dr. Peebles's laboratory appears on the large central monitor.[/p]

[p]You've got to get away from the fierce tyran-nosaur. You grab Denny's hand and take off through the trees. The dinosaur chases you, but it's too big to fit easily between the trees.[/p] [p]You and Denny zig one way and zag another. Finally the two of you crouch down behind a thick tree trunk. You both gasp for air.[/p] [p]In the distance, you can see the tyrannosaur. It glances all around. At last it lets out a defeated-sounding roar and ambles off.[/p] [p]“Way to go!” Denny shouts. You and your brother high-five each other. Now all you have to do is go back to the swamp and find the chronometer.[/p] [p]But which direction is it? You've done so much twisting and turning, you aren't sure where the swamp is.[/p] [p]Luckily, Denny seems to remember the way. You follow him through the forest and finally come to the swampland. As you rush over to the pool of quicksand, all you can think about is the time ticking by. How much longer before Denny disappears forever?[/p]

[p]You decide to go toward the futuristic city. All around you are buildings made of shiny metal and glass. Cars – with wings – fly above your head. The streets are empty and clean, with no litter – not even a gum wrapper.[/p] [p]Is this New York in the future? It certainly looks different from the one you're visiting in the present.[/p] [p]You're about to start looking for Denny when a hand closes on your shoulder in an icy grip.[/p] [p]“Human?” a hollow-sounding voice says. “You're under arrest!”[/p] [p]You whirl around. Gripping your shoulder is a shiny metal robot with a policeman's badge welded to its chest. The robot's face is expressionless, and it's holding something that looks like a laser gun. No wonder everything is so clean and quiet, you think. The city is run by machines![/p] [p]“Don't you know that humans aren't allowed out in the streets?” the robot demands.[/p] [p]“I come from … another place,” you quickly reply. “I don't know your rules. Please give me another chance.”[/p] [p]“That's for the judge to decide,” the robot says. “Come with me.”[/p]

[p]“Look at this one!” says a little robot. It gazes at the sign in front of the force field. “It's the 'Couch Potato' exhibit,” the small robot goes on. It begins making strange noises again.[/p] [p]“It's not polite to laugh at the humans,” one of the bigger robots says.[/p] [p]“But Mommy,” replies the little one. “It's so funny-looking. Here, human!” it adds. It shoves something through the force field. You lean down to pick up a candy bar.[/p] [p]“Look!” says the little one. “It picked up the candy! It's eating it!” The small robot pushes another candy bar through the force field.[/p] [p]With a sinking feeling, you realize that you're stuck here for good. But cheer up. At least when the little robots visit, you'll get to eat plenty of candy.[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]“The three objects are a pin, a pipe, and a potato,” you tell the robot.[/p] [p]“WRONG!” the teacher thunders. “You know the penalty for a [em]wrong[/em] answer! Now step forward!”[/p] [p]You start toward the frammilizer. Slowly you feel for the chronometer around your neck. But before you can press any buttons, the robot snatches it away with its magnetic claws.[/p] [p]“No tricks!” the robot says. “Now enter the frammilizer!”[/p] [p]There's no way out now.[/p] [p]As you step into the strange metal box, your heart sinks to the bottom of your toes. You're a complete failure. You haven't found Denny, and you couldn't answer the teacher's question. Then again, you're about to become the first kid you know to be frammilized.[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]“Excuse me,” you say, walking over to the truck driver. “The dispatcher asked if you could take me on your delivery. My uncle owns the store you're delivering to, and I need a ride there.”[/p] [p]“Sure, kid,” he says. “Why not?”[/p] [p]You follow him to the green truck. He opens the back. Cases of fresh fish are piled inside. The dead fish stare at you with cold, empty eyes.[/p] [p]“Hop in,” the driver says.[/p] [p]“In there? B-but …” you stammer.[/p] [p]“The cab's full,” he says. “Do you want a ride or not?”[/p] [p]“Uh …” You really need to be in the front with him. But you don't know what else to do, so you climb into the back of the truck and sit down.[/p] [p]When the driver shuts the door, everything goes dark. You can't believe how bad it smells back here. And the fishes' cold, scaly bodies keep brushing against you.[/p] [p]Yuck![/p]

[p]As the truck bears down on your family, the driver seems totally paralyzed. In fact, he seems to have fainted![/p] [p]You struggle out of your seat belt. It's up to you to do something![/p] [p]This is what you planned for.[/p] [p]This is why you came back to this time. But somehow you didn't think it would be so hard to stop the truck.[/p] [p]Maybe you can steer the truck onto another street. Or should you try to reach the brakes?[/p] [p]Make a decision quick![/p]

[p]You hold your breath and brace yourself as you fall toward the bubbling pot.[/p] [p]You pull your arms into your chest. And your hand hits a button. A button on the chronometer![/p] [p]Your body begins to tingle. You close your eyes and cross your fingers. And then you land.[/p] [p]But not in bubbling oil![/p] [p]Blinking, you gaze around. You're in a room. Dr. Peebles's lab. You made it back to the present![/p] [p]“Welcome, time traveler!” Dr. Peebles greets you. “How did it go?”[/p] [p]You're about to answer when you remember Denny. Oh, no! You left Denny in the past.[/p] [p]“I've got to save my brother –” you start to say. And then you remember the pot of oil. The [em]boiling[/em] oil. A lot Denny did for me when I was about to be fried! you think.[/p] [p]“Excellent!” you say to Dr. Peebles. “Everything was excellent.”[/p] [p]Then you head back toward the museum exhibits. Of course, now you have to explain to your parents why their youngest son is now called Ruthelford and lives in medieval times![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]Yes! The door of the truck opens. There's Abe, looking absolutely shocked as mice scamper out of the truck and all over the loading dock.[/p] [p]“Hey you,” you hear Abe call to the driver of the green truck. “Get out of that truck and help us clear up this mess.”[/p] [p]Congratulations, time traveler. The truck drivers are so busy chasing white mice that the green truck doesn't get to the intersection until way after your family is out of there.[/p] [p]You did it! You're a hero. You saved your family. And you saved the lives of two thousand white mice.[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You decide to take your chances in the moat.[/p] [p][em]SPLASH[/em] ! The water is cold – but at least you escaped that fierce-looking knight.[/p] [p]Then you hear it – a loud clacking sound.[/p] [p]A crocodile snapping his jaws. He's right in front of you! And he looks mighty hungry![/p] [p]You turn away from the crocodile and swim in the opposite direction. You wish you could swim faster. The crocodile's gaining on you![/p] [p]Suddenly another crocodile pops up in your path. And another.[/p] [p]You're totally surrounded by hungry green crocodiles![/p] [p]You grab for the chronometer around your neck. But before you can press the buttons, the crocodile nearest you snatches it out of your hand.[/p] [p]In one gulp, he swallows it![/p] [p]Too bad. The chronometer was only the appetizer. The main course is about to be served – and it's you![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You listen as Jarmal explains about the rebellion.[/p] [p]“The robots were originally created by humans as servants. But gradually their powers grew greater and greater. Eventually, they took over.”[/p] [p]“So now the humans are fighting back?” you ask.[/p] [p]“Exactly,” Jarmal says. “We expect the battle to begin any minute. We –”[/p] [p][em]BOOM[/em] ! His words are cut off by a deafening blast.[/p]

[p]You reach the swamp and grab Denny's hands. With all your might, you pull. But Denny is completely stuck![/p] [p]You pull Denny again. This time he panics. He grabs wildly at you. The chronometer flies off the chain around your neck and into the mud.[/p] [p]Now the tyrannosaur is only a few yards away. Its terrible face is so close, you can see its sharp, pointed teeth and smell its hot, stinking breath. The dinosaur roars, shaking the nearby trees.[/p] [p]You yank Denny one more time. With a loud [em]plop[/em] ! he's freed from the quicksand. But now the tyrannosaur is only a few feet away. It opens its mouth wide and stretches its fierce claws toward you.[/p] [p]Frantically, you look around for the chronometer. You've got to get back to the present. But there's no trace of the stopwatch. It's been sucked into the mud![/p] [p]Should you try to dig the chronometer out of the muck? Or try to run away from the tyrannosaur? Which will you choose?[/p]
p.next: If you decide to dig for the chronometer
Think you can escape the tyrannosaur?

p.text: [p]“Welcome to the rebel forces!” Jarmal cries, shaking your hand. He shows you a map of The City and explains the battle plan. “This building beams power to all the robots,” he says, pointing to a large plant on the map. “If we can blow up this power plant, the robots will become helpless.”[/p] [p]Next, Jarmal shows you a small, red box. “This box contains a special explosive,” he explains. “It must be placed within three feet of the power source.”[/p] [p]You follow Jarmal through the tunnel to a stairway leading to a park. Through the trees you see the power plant. It's a tall, white, completely round building with a large antenna extending from the roof.[/p] [p]Jarmal tells you that all entrances are heavily guarded by robots. “Since none of the robots will recognize you, you've been chosen to enter the power plant,” he says.[/p] [p]“What?” you exclaim. “You want [em]me[/em] to enter the power plant?”[/p] [p]“Didn't I mention it before?” asks Jarmal. “Our entire plan depends on you. Are you ready?”[/p]

[p]“It is a great honor for a human to be accepted into the college.” The robot leads you out of the plant to a small flying car. “And you know what happens to humans who turn down robot honors.”[/p] [p]You don't know – but you can guess.[/p] [p]The car lands on top of a tall brick building.[/p] [p]“Your lecture hall is right this way,” the robot tells you.[/p] [p]“I need time to prepare –” you start to say.[/p] [p]“Nonsense,” the robot cuts you off. “A good teacher doesn't need preparation.”[/p] [p]The next thing you know, you're facing a large classroom full of shiny metal robots. They all have portable computers in front of them, ready to take notes.[/p] [p]Maybe, just maybe, the rebels will manage to free The City and help you and Denny get out of the future.[/p] [p]In the meantime, you cross your fingers and start to tell the robots everything you've ever known about snazzilizers and romiframptons.[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You crouch down and open the foot-high wooden door to the Lair of the Lizard. You can't see anything but darkness. You hold your breath to make yourself smaller, then wriggle through the door on your stomach.[/p] [p]Inside, you stand up. You're in a dark, misty room. Flies and other insects dart from wall to wall.[/p] [p]A bearded man in flowing robes bursts into the room from another door. He peers through the mist. “Wizard!” he calls. “Wizard! Where are you?”[/p] [p]“Excuse me?” you say politely. “Aren't you the wizard?”[/p] [p]“Of course I am!” he bellows. “I'm the wizard, but I can't find my lizard named Wizard. Have you seen him?”[/p] [p]“No,” you say, “but I'm looking for someone, too. I –”[/p] [p]“I know who you are and what you seek,” he interrupts. “You are a traveler in time.”[/p] [p]“Yes,” you tell him, surprised. “And I'm looking –”[/p] [p]“The young boy you seek is lost in the Corridors of Time,” he says. “To find him, you must answer a question of time.”[/p] [p]At the mention of time, you glance at the chronometer. Time is running out![/p]

[p]“Denny!” you cry. “Come back!”[/p] [p]You run to the back of the Lair. Denny is slipping into a small, dark opening between two bookcases.[/p] [p]Inside the opening you can hear heavy breathing. It doesn't sound human![/p] [p]Do you still have the nerve to follow Denny?[/p]

[p]“Human spies!” the robot with the laser gun declares. “You are under arrest!”[/p] [p]You untwist yourself and float out of the chamber. “We weren't spying!” you protest. “We were only –”[/p] [p]“Silence!” the robot snaps.[/p] [p]In a panic, you pull out the chronometer and take a glance. You and Denny have to get home.[/p] [p]“Please,” you beg the robot. “I have to get my brother –”[/p] [p]“Explain it to the captain!” the robot says. It snatches away the chronometer.[/p] [p]“No!” you scream. “Give that back!” You grab for the chronometer, but the robot holds it beyond your reach. “Come along now!” it snarls. It clamps its metal claws around your wrist. “You, too!” it adds, reaching for Denny.[/p] [p]“You can't make me!” Denny kicks the robot hard on its metal shin and takes off running.[/p] [p]The robot stops for a moment. You can hear something whirring inside its head. “The captain will explain what to do,” it mutters. “Now come with me.”[/p]

[p]“I'm ready to begin the duel,” the knight tells you. He plucks an apple from the tree. Then he winds up and throws the apple toward you. Holding the club like a baseball bat, you smack the apple. It soars down the path, past the knight.[/p] [p]“I can hit it much farther,” the knight boasts. He takes his place at the end of the drawbridge.[/p] [p]Now you pick an apple from the tree. You stand on the pitcher's mound and eye the knight. Then you wind up. You pitch.[/p] [p]The knight swings with all his might.[/p] [p]And hits a blooper a few feet in front of you.[/p] [p]All right![/p] [p]“I won,” you call. “Now can I go into the castle? I need to look for my brother.”[/p] [p]The knight nods. “Very well, stranger,” he says sadly. “You may enter the castle. But according to the rules, I must jump into the moat.”[/p]

[p]You'd like to help the woman, but it's more important to find Denny. You race out of the smoky room.[/p] [p]“Halt!” the woman screams. “You've failed the knight test!”[/p] [p]“What?”[/p] [p]“I'm not really a helpless maiden,” the woman explains. She breaks free of the chains holding her to the wall. “I'm actually the dragon's keeper. This is a test we set up for future knights. Anyone who refuses to try to rescue the maiden fails.”[/p] [p]“But I don't want to be a knight!” you protest.[/p] [p]“Of course you do,” says the maiden. “Otherwise, why would you be in this room?”[/p] [p]“I'm looking for my brother –” you start to say, but it's no use.[/p] [p]The maiden snaps her finger, and the dragon slithers into the room toward you![/p]

[p]You set out along the walkway, searching for the power source. You come to a large platform guarded by a robot.[/p] [p]“Halt, human!” it demands. “What is your business here?”[/p] [p]“I'm here to fix the romiframpton,” you tell the robot.[/p] [p]“What's wrong with it?” the robot demands.[/p] [p]You think quickly, then say the first thing that comes to your mind. “The snazzilizer is pulsing out of phase.”[/p] [p]“No wonder it's been so scaloopy lately,” the robot replies. “You're the first entity – robot or human – to diagnose the problem correctly.”[/p] [p]The robot actually believed you! You're in shock, and it takes you a minute to speak.[/p] [p]“… I'd better get to work,” you say finally.[/p] [p]“Never mind the romiframpton,” the robot says. “Now that we know what's wrong, we can fix it ourselves. But with your mechanical genius we can use you as an instructor in the electronics college. Come with me.”[/p] [p]“No,” you protest. “I need to –”[/p] [p]“I said, come with me!” the robot repeats in a nasty metallic twang.[/p]

[p]“No way,” you protest. “I'm not going in there.”[/p] [p]“If you want help finding your brother,” Jarmal snaps, “you'd better do it.”[/p] [p]Finally you agree. What else can you do?[/p] [p]Jarmal hands you the red box with the explosives. “Remember, you have to place it within three feet of the power source. And one more thing … you have only one minute to get away before it blows.”[/p] [p]“How am I supposed to get into the building?” you ask.[/p] [p]“There are two ways to get in,” Jarmal tells you. “One is to find some way to get past the robot guards at the door.”[/p] [p]“No thanks,” you mutter. “What's the other way?”[/p] [p]“You could crawl in through the air duct,” Jarmal says. “That way you'll avoid the robots – but the ducts are very narrow. Crawling through them could be very, very dangerous.”[/p] [p]How will you enter the building?[/p] [p]Decide carefully – the fate of humans on Earth may depend on your answer![/p]
p.next: Crawl in through the air duct?

p.text: [p]You decide to try the truth.[/p] [p]“I'm not a spy,” you repeat. “But I'm not a crew member either. I'm actually a time traveler.”[/p] [p]“Likely story!” the captain snarls. “If you're a time traveler, prove it!”[/p] [p]“The device your guard took from me is a chronometer,” you explain. “That's how I move from one time to another.”[/p] [p]The guard hands the chronometer to the captain. She glances at it, then hands it back to you. You quickly slip it under your uniform in case she changes her mind.[/p] [p]“If you are really from the past,” she says to you, “what color were the eyes of an allosaurus?”[/p] [p]“I'm not from [em]that[/em] far back,” you protest.[/p] [p]She sighs. “Okay, while I decide what to do with you, wait outside.”[/p] [p]The guards each take one of your arms and roughly shove you out into the corridor.[/p]

[p]Denny screams in terror as the knight prepares to toss him to the ground.[/p] [p]“Stop!” you yell. “That's King Ruthbert's son, Ruthelford,” you say.[/p] [p]The knight looks at you in surprise. “Of course. Why do you think I'm getting ready to dash his brains out?”[/p] [p]“King Ruthbert will pay a huge ransom for him,” you go on. “More gold and jewels than you can imagine.”[/p] [p]“Is that right?” the knight replies. “How do you know?”[/p] [p]“I'm an agent of the king,” you tell the knight. It's the first he that enters your mind.[/p] [p]“Really? Then why are your hands tied?” the knight asks.[/p] [p]“Well, uh, er …” You try to think of a good answer. “Untie me and I'll show you!”[/p] [p]The knight looks you up and down. He draws his sword.[/p] [p]Oh, no! What's he going to do?[/p]

[p]You reach out to grab Denny before hitting the buttons on the chronometer.[/p] [p]“NOOO!” Denny shrieks. He pulls away and tears off down the street.[/p] [p]“Denny, come back here!” you yell. But Denny keeps going. He darts across the street and runs smack into his double – the future Denny. They both fall onto the sidewalk.[/p] [p]Your mother's face goes white when she sees two Dennys.[/p] [p]“Okay,” your father demands. “Which one of you is really my son?”[/p] [p]“I am!” says one of the red-haired Dennys.[/p] [p]“[em]I[/em] am,” insists the other one. He punches the first one on the arm. The other Denny punches back.[/p] [p]You've got to do something! You rush across the street and grab both Dennys. Then you push the buttons on the chronometer.[/p]

[p]You grab the rake. Then, holding it out in front of you, you inch toward the door on the other side of the room. The vine follows you, its flower head still snapping like mad.[/p] [p]You're about to reach for the doorknob when something grabs your ankle.[/p] [p]The vine is coiling around your legs![/p] [p]Desperately, you hack at the vine with the rake. But it's no use. The vine rapidly works its way up your body, wrapping you up as tightly as a mummy![/p] [p]Suddenly the door opens. Someone walks in, singing the words to your favorite song.[/p] [p]It's Denny![/p] [p]You open your mouth to yell to him. But it's no use. You can't speak – you can't even move.[/p] [p]You hear Denny moving around the room, looking at everything. Then he stops right in front of you.[/p] [p]He looks closely at the vine holding you prisoner. “Cool plant,” he says.[/p] [p]Cool plant?[/p] [p]That's not a plant – it's you![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You ask someone to point out the dnver of the green truck. He's a gray-haired man in a plaid jacket.[/p] [p]Now you have to decide what to say to him. Maybe you can get him to take you along with him, and then, at the crucial moment, you can steer the truck away from your family.[/p] [p]Finally, you come up with two plans. You could tell him you're from out of town and you're lost, and you want a ride to your hotel. Or you could pretend the dispatcher wants him to take you along on the next delivery.[/p] [p]Which will you choose?[/p]

[p]“Please help me!” you beg the robot. “I'm looking for my brother and –”[/p] [p]“Silence, intruder,” the robot commands. Keeping its laser trained on you, it waves you over to a chair in front of one of the monitors.[/p] [p]“You will be my helper in the Teletime room, human. I need someone to help me study the past,” the robot explains. It points to one of the monitors. “You will watch this screen all night and all day and report to me on what you see.”[/p] [p]That's not bad, you think. At least I'll get to watch TV![/p] [p]You settle into one of the cushioned chairs opposite the monitor. On the screen, George Washington is crossing the Delaware River. You watch him do it again.[/p] [p]And again.[/p] [p]It's interesting the first few times, but after that you get bored. [em]Really[/em] bored.[/p] [p]The days, months, and finally years slowly pass. George is still crossing the river. And you're still watching.[/p] [p]Compared to this nonstop history lesson, going to museums with your parents was a total blast![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You've got to find the chronometer. You stick your arm deep into the quicksand. You feel around with your fingers … nothing.[/p] [p]Suddenly the [em]Tyrannosaurus rex[/em] lets out a roar.[/p] [p]You plunge both hands into the quicksand. Beside you, Denny drops to his hands and knees to search, too.[/p] [p]You sift frantically through the mud. The dinosaur comes closer and closer. He reaches out one claw. Then he lets out a tremendous sound. It's a burp from his earlier feast – a gigantic burp as loud as an explosion![/p] [p]The force of the burp knocks both you and Denny over. The two of you pitch forward … right into the quicksand![/p] [p]Oh, no! You're both being pulled down, down into the quivering muck, to meet …[/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You decide to try to get back to Dr. Peebles's lab. But is there enough time?[/p] [p]The student in front of you has given a wrong answer.[/p] [p]“No!” the girl cries. “Give me another chance!” But the teacher shoves the student into the fram-milizer. And now the robot's red electronic eye fixes on you.[/p] [p]“How many electrons can be found in a pound of taffy?” the teacher asks you.[/p] [p]You grasp the chronometer and place your fingers over the top and bottom buttons to return to Dr. Peebles's laboratory.[/p] [p]“Answer!” the robot thunders.[/p] [p]You quickly press the buttons.[/p] [p][em]SPROIINNGGG![/em] There is a hideous sound as the chronometer disintegrates in your hand. Tiny wheels and computer chips fly all over your desk.[/p] [p]“Answer the question!” the robot repeats.[/p] [p]Too bad. There's no way you can return to your time. But cheer up – unless you know the answer to the question, you won't have to stay in the classroom very long![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You start up the metallic ladder, making sure that the red box is still inside your pocket. The building is at least thirty stories high. At the top of the steps is a pulsing green glow.[/p] [p]The power source, you realize.[/p] [p]You climb faster. Soon you are at the top of the ladder, staring at a huge, green-glowing orb inside a round room with glass panels.[/p] [p]The glow is so bright you can hardly see. You look for a way into the room and finally notice a small door with a sign: EXTREME DANGER, DO NOT ENTER.[/p] [p]But you have to enter, to leave the explosive device.[/p] [p]Or do you?[/p] [p]Jarmal said only that the explosive device needed to be within three feet of the power source. He never said it had to be in the same room. Maybe you're already close enough.[/p] [p]Decide what to do right away – a robot guard is coming![/p]
p.next: Or to place the device against the wall and see what happens

p.text: [p]All right! The robot fell for it![/p] [p]You can see yourself stepping into the Chro-noport. Then you hear Dr. Peebles say: “One more thing! Remember to hold the buttons down for at least five seconds!”[/p] [p]That's exactly what you needed to hear. Now you know how to make the chronometer work! But you still can't find Denny.[/p] [p]“I don't believe your Teletime machine really shows the past,” you say.[/p] [p]“What!!??” the robot roars. “How dare you insult my machine!” Its finger moves closer to the trigger.[/p] [p]“If it really works,” you say quickly, “then show me the present.”[/p] [p]“The present?” the robot cries.[/p] [p]“Yes!” You nod. “The scenes from the past could have been films or videotapes. If I see scenes from the present, I'll believe the machine really works.”[/p] [p]“Very well,” the robot grumbles. “But right afterward I will take pleasure in vaporizing you. Any particular scene in the present?” it adds sarcastically.[/p] [p]You smile. Your plan is working.[/p]

[p]No way. You're not going to miss seeing a real dinosaur being born. You'll catch up with Denny in a few minutes.[/p] [p]You keep your eyes on the big speckled egg.[/p] [p]This is too cool, you think. Maybe it's a brachiosaurus or a triceratops. You've always wanted to see one of them.[/p] [p][em]Tap. Tap. Tap.[/em] [/p] [p]The baby dinosaur struggles to get out.[/p] [p][em]CRACK![/em] The enormous egg splits open.[/p] [p]You lean forward – you're dying to see this![/p] [p]Then out it pops. You see a long tail … a tiny beak … and soft wet feathers.[/p] [p]FEATHERS?[/p] [p]You can't believe it. This baby's not a dinosaur.[/p] [p]It's a chicken. Some kind of weird, prehistoric chicken! Okay. Now you've learned your lesson. Never count your dinosaurs before they hatch![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]You follow the robot to meet the captain.[/p] [p]The captain of the ship is a woman. A human woman – but she looks really mean.[/p] [p]“You were caught spying in our secret anti-gravity device,” she says sternly. “The penalty is immediate execution. Now what do you have to say for yourself?”[/p] [p]Immediate execution![/p] [p]Somehow, you have to get her to understand what you were doing there. But what if she doesn't believe your story? Maybe it would be better to pretend you're a new member of the space crew and didn't know better.[/p] [p]Decide well. Your life depends on it![/p]

[p]“You're not the boss of me!” Denny says again. “Go ahead, Dad!”[/p] [p]“Prepare to boil, spy!” the knight on your right side snarls. He starts to drag you to the edge of the platform.[/p] [p]“Wait!” you cry. You look at the king. “Before you carry out the sentence, I have something that belongs to your son.”[/p] [p]“Halt!” the king commands. “What is it?”[/p] [p]“A valuable piece of jewelry,” you say. “Please allow me to give it to him.”[/p] [p]“Yeah!” Denny says. “Give it to me!”[/p]

[p]The teacher turns to you. “Stand up,” the robot orders.[/p] [p]Nervously, you stand. You hold your breath as the teacher starts to speak. This is the moment. Can you answer the question, or will you be fram-milized?[/p] [p]“The ancient British wizard Morgred used a magic spell to travel in time. The spell made use of three magical objects. What are they?”[/p] [p]Morgred? You remember him. But can you remember the answer to the question? If you can't, you'll have to guess! Think carefully, then answer.[/p]
p.next: Are the three objects a pin, a pipe, and a potato?
Or are the magical objects three white stones?

p.text: [p]Somehow you've got to talk Denny into coming back to the present with you. But how?[/p] [p]Then you get an idea. “Denny,” you say very calmly. “I'm going back to Dr. Peebles's laboratory now. But I don't want you to come with me.”[/p] [p]“Why not?” Denny asks suspiciously.[/p] [p]“It's none of your business,” you say as nastily as you can. “You can come back later today – or tomorrow.”[/p] [p]“No!” Denny whines. “I want to go back [em]now[/em] .”[/p] [p]“Well, you can't,” you say. “I'm going without you.”[/p] [p]“NOOOO!” he whines louder. “Take me with you!”[/p] [p]“Sorry.”[/p] [p]“I'll tell Mom!” he insists. “I'll tell her how you're always trying to be the boss of me.”[/p] [p]“Oh, all right,” you say, trying to sound disgusted. “Hold my hand, then.” Looking pleased, Denny takes your hand. You glance down at the chronometer. Forty-five seconds – plenty of time to spare. And Denny doesn't even realize that he tricked himself![/p] [p class="end"]THE END[/p]

[p]Mice! The boxes are full of mice. White mice to be used at the lab for research.[/p] [p]Looking at the mice gives you an idea.[/p] [p]As fast as you can, you start opening the boxes and releasing the mice. Before you know it, there are mice all over the truck.[/p] [p]“Help! Help!” you scream, banging on the back of the truck.[/p] [p]Will anyone hear you?[/p]
